17656.text: §¶The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

17657.text: ¶Hear, heavens,/_and listen, earth; for Yahweh has spoken:/“I have nourished and brought up children,/_and they have rebelled against me.

17658.text: /The ox knows his owner,/_and the donkey his master’s crib;/_but Israel doesn’t know,/_my people don’t consider.”

17659.text: /Ah sinful nation,/_a people loaded with iniquity,/_offspring of evildoers,/_children who deal corruptly!/They have forsaken Yahweh./_They have despised the Holy One of Israel./_They are estranged and backward.

17660.text: /Why should you be beaten more,/_that you revolt more and more?/The whole head is sick,/_and the whole heart faint.

17661.text: /From the sole of the foot even to the head there is no soundness in it:/_wounds, welts, and open sores./_They haven’t been closed, neither bandaged, neither soothed with oil.

17662.text: /Your country is desolate./_Your cities are burned with fire./_Strangers devour your land in your presence,/_and it is desolate,/_as overthrown by strangers.

17663.text: /The daughter of Zion is left like a shelter in a vineyard,/_like a hut in a field of melons,/_like a besieged city.

17664.text: /Unless Yahweh of Armies had left to us a very small remnant,/_we would have been as Sodom;/_we would have been like Gomorrah.

17665.text: /Hear Yahweh’s word, you rulers of Sodom!/_Listen to the law of our God, you people of Gomorrah!

17666.text: /“What are the multitude of your sacrifices to me?”, says Yahweh./_“I have had enough of the burnt offerings of rams,/_and the fat of fed animals./_I don’t delight in the blood of bulls,/_or of lambs,/_or of male goats.

17667.text: /When you come to appear before me,/_who has required this at your hand, to trample my courts?

17668.text: /Bring no more vain offerings./_Incense is an abomination to me;/_new moons, Sabbaths, and convocations:/_I can’t bear with evil assemblies.

17669.text: /My soul hates your New Moons and your appointed feasts./_They are a burden to me./_I am weary of bearing them.

17670.text: /When you spread out your hands, I will hide my eyes from you./_Yes, when you make many prayers, I will not hear./_Your hands are full of blood.

17671.text: /Wash yourselves, make yourself clean./_Put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes./_Cease to do evil.

17672.text: /Learn to do well./_Seek justice./_Relieve the oppressed./_Judge the fatherless./_Plead for the widow.”

17673.text: ¶“Come now, and let us reason together,” says Yahweh:/_“Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow./_Though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.

17674.text: /If you are willing and obedient,/_you shall eat the good of the land;

17675.text: /_but if you refuse and rebel, you shall be devoured with the sword;/_for the mouth of Yahweh has spoken it.”

17676.text: ¶How the faithful city has become a prostitute!/_She was full of justice; righteousness lodged in her,/_but now murderers.

17677.text: /Your silver has become dross,/_your wine mixed with water.

17678.text: /Your princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves./_Everyone loves bribes, and follows after rewards./_They don’t judge the fatherless,/_neither does the cause of the widow come to them.

17679.text: /Therefore the Lord, Yahweh of Armies,/_the Mighty One of Israel, says:/“Ah, I will get relief from my adversaries,/_and avenge myself on my enemies;

17680.text: /and I will turn my hand on you,/_thoroughly purge away your dross,/_and will take away all your tin.

17681.text: /I will restore your judges as at the first,/_and your counselors as at the beginning./Afterward you shall be called ‘The city of righteousness,/_a faithful town.’

17682.text: /Zion shall be redeemed with justice,/_and her converts with righteousness.

17683.text: /But the destruction of transgressors and sinners shall be together,/_and those who forsake Yahweh shall be consumed.

17684.text: /For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which you have desired,/_and you shall be confounded for the gardens that you have chosen.

17685.text: /For you shall be as an oak whose leaf fades,/_and as a garden that has no water.

17686.text: /The strong will be like tinder,/_and his work like a spark./They will both burn together,/_and no one will quench them.”

17687.text: ¶This is what Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

17688.text: ¶It shall happen in the latter days, that the mountain of Yahweh’s house shall be established on the top of the mountains,/_and shall be raised above the hills;/_and all nations shall flow to it.

17689.text: /Many peoples shall go and say,/_“Come, let’s go up to the mountain of Yahweh,/_to the house of the God of Jacob;/_and he will teach us of his ways,/_and we will walk in his paths.”/For out of Zion the law shall go out,/_and Yahweh’s word from Jerusalem.

17690.text: /He will judge between the nations,/_and will decide concerning many peoples;/_and they shall beat their swords into plowshares,/_and their spears into pruning hooks./Nation shall not lift up sword against nation,/_neither shall they learn war any more.

17691.text: ¶House of Jacob, come, and let us walk in the light of Yahweh.

17692.text: /For you have forsaken your people, the house of Jacob,/_because they are filled from the east,/_with those who practice divination like the Philistines,/_and they clasp hands with the children of foreigners.

17693.text: /Their land is full of silver and gold,/_neither is there any end of their treasures./Their land also is full of horses,/_neither is there any end of their chariots.

17694.text: /Their land also is full of idols./_They worship the work of their own hands,/_that which their own fingers have made.

17695.text: /Man is brought low,/_and mankind is humbled;/_therefore don’t forgive them.

17696.text: /Enter into the rock,/_and hide in the dust,/from before the terror of Yahweh,/_and from the glory of his majesty.

17697.text: /The lofty looks of man will be brought low,/_the haughtiness of men will be bowed down,/_and Yahweh alone will be exalted in that day.

17698.text: /For there will be a day of Yahweh of Armies for all that is proud and haughty,/_and for all that is lifted up;/_and it shall be brought low:

17699.text: /_For all the cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up,/_for all the oaks of Bashan,

17700.text: /_For all the high mountains,/_for all the hills that are lifted up,

17701.text: /_For every lofty tower,/_for every fortified wall,

17702.text: /_For all the ships of Tarshish,/_and for all pleasant imagery.

17703.text: /The loftiness of man shall be bowed down,/_and the haughtiness of men shall be brought low;/_and Yahweh alone shall be exalted in that day.

17705.text: /Men shall go into the caves of the rocks,/_and into the holes of the earth,/_from before the terror of Yahweh,/_and from the glory of his majesty,/_when he arises to shake the earth mightily.

17706.text: /In that day, men shall cast away their idols of silver,/_and their idols of gold,/_which have been made for themselves to worship,/_to the moles and to the bats;

17707.text: /_To go into the caverns of the rocks,/_and into the clefts of the ragged rocks,/_from before the terror of Yahweh,/_and from the glory of his majesty,/_when he arises to shake the earth mightily.

17708.text: /Stop trusting in man, whose breath is in his nostrils;/_for of what account is he?

17709.text: ¶For, behold, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, takes away from Jerusalem and from Judah supply and support,/_the whole supply of bread,/_and the whole supply of water;

17710.text: /_the mighty man,/_the man of war,/_the judge,/_the prophet,/_the diviner,/_the elder,

17711.text: /_the captain of fifty,/_the honorable man,/_the counselor,/_the skilled craftsman,/_and the clever enchanter.

17712.text: /I will give boys to be their princes,/_and children shall rule over them.

17713.text: /The people will be oppressed,/_everyone by another,/_and everyone by his neighbor./The child will behave himself proudly against the old man,/_and the base against the honorable.

17714.text: /Indeed a man shall take hold of his brother in the house of his father, saying,/_“You have clothing, you be our ruler,/_and let this ruin be under your hand.”

17715.text: /In that day he will cry out, saying, “I will not be a healer;/_for in my house is neither bread nor clothing./_You shall not make me ruler of the people.”

17716.text: /For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen;/_because their tongue and their doings are against Yahweh,/to provoke the eyes of his glory.

17717.text: /The look of their faces testify against them./_They parade their sin like Sodom./_They don’t hide it./_Woe to their soul!/_For they have brought disaster upon themselves.

17718.text: /Tell the righteous “Good!”/_For they shall eat the fruit of their deeds.

17719.text: /Woe to the wicked!/_Disaster is upon them;/_for the deeds of his hands will be paid back to him.

17720.text: /As for my people, children are their oppressors,/_and women rule over them./_My people, those who lead you cause you to err,/_and destroy the way of your paths.

17721.text: /Yahweh stands up to contend,/_and stands to judge the peoples.

17722.text: /Yahweh will enter into judgment with the elders of his people,/_and their leaders:/_“It is you who have eaten up the vineyard./_The plunder of the poor is in your houses.

17723.text: /_What do you mean that you crush my people,/_and grind the face of the poor?” says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies.

17724.text: /Moreover Yahweh said, “Because the daughters of Zion are haughty,/_and walk with outstretched necks and flirting eyes,/_walking to trip as they go,/_jingling ornaments on their feet;

17725.text: /therefore the Lord brings sores on the crown of the head of the women of Zion,/_and Yahweh will make their scalps bald.”

17726.text: ¶In that day the Lord will take away the beauty of their anklets, the headbands, the crescent necklaces,

17727.text: the earrings, the bracelets, the veils,

17728.text: the headdresses, the ankle chains, the sashes, the perfume bottles, the charms,

17729.text: the signet rings, the nose rings,

17730.text: the fine robes, the capes, the cloaks, the purses,

17731.text: the hand mirrors, the fine linen garments, the tiaras, and the shawls.

17732.text: ¶It shall happen that instead of sweet spices, there shall be rottenness;/_instead of a belt, a rope;/_instead of well set hair, baldness;/_instead of a robe, a wearing of sackcloth;/_and branding instead of beauty.

17733.text: /Your men shall fall by the sword,/_and your mighty in the war.

17734.text: /Her gates shall lament and mourn;/_and she shall be desolate and sit on the ground.

17735.text: ¶Seven women shall take hold of one man in that day, saying, “We will eat our own bread, and wear our own clothing: only let us be called by your name. Take away our reproach.”

17736.text: ¶In that day, Yahweh’s branch will be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the land will be the beauty and glory of the survivors of Israel.

17737.text: It will happen, that he who is left in Zion, and he who remains in Jerusalem, shall be called holy, even everyone who is written among the living in Jerusalem;

17738.text: when the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from within it, by the spirit of justice, and by the spirit of burning.

17739.text: Yahweh will create over the whole habitation of Mount Zion, and over her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day, and the shining of a flaming fire by night; for over all the glory will be a canopy.

17740.text: There will be a pavilion for a shade in the daytime from the heat, and for a refuge and for a shelter from storm and from rain.

17741.text: ¶Let me sing for my well beloved a song of my beloved about his vineyard./_My beloved had a vineyard on a very fruitful hill.

17742.text: /He dug it up,/_gathered out its stones,/_planted it with the choicest vine,/_built a tower in the middle of it,/_and also cut out a wine press therein./He looked for it to yield grapes,/_but it yielded wild grapes.

17743.text: /“Now, inhabitants of Jerusalem and men of Judah,/_please judge between me and my vineyard.

17744.text: /What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not done in it?/_Why, when I looked for it to yield grapes, did it yield wild grapes?

17745.text: /Now I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard./_I will take away its hedge, and it will be eaten up./_I will break down its wall of it, and it will be trampled down.

17746.text: /I will lay it a wasteland./_It won’t be pruned nor hoed,/_but it will grow briers and thorns./_I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain on it.”

17747.text: /For the vineyard of Yahweh of Armies is the house of Israel,/_and the men of Judah his pleasant plant:/_and he looked for justice, but, behold, oppression;/_for righteousness, but, behold, a cry of distress.

17748.text: /Woe to those who join house to house,/_who lay field to field, until there is no room,/_and you are made to dwell alone in the middle of the land!

17749.text: /In my ears, Yahweh of Armies says: “Surely many houses will be desolate,/_even great and beautiful, unoccupied.

17750.text: /For ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath,/_and a homer of seed shall yield an ephah.”

17751.text: /Woe to those who rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink;/_who stay late into the night, until wine inflames them!

17752.text: /The harp, lyre, tambourine, and flute, with wine, are at their feasts;/_but they don’t respect the work of Yahweh,/_neither have they considered the operation of his hands.

17753.text: /Therefore my people go into captivity for lack of knowledge./_Their honorable men are famished,/_and their multitudes are parched with thirst.

17754.text: /Therefore Sheol has enlarged its desire,/_and opened its mouth without measure;/_and their glory, their multitude, their pomp, and he who rejoices among them, descend into it.

17755.text: /So man is brought low,/_mankind is humbled,/_and the eyes of the arrogant ones are humbled;

17756.text: /but Yahweh of Armies is exalted in justice,/_and God the Holy One is sanctified in righteousness.

17757.text: /Then the lambs will graze as in their pasture,/_and strangers will eat the ruins of the rich.

17758.text: /Woe to those who draw iniquity with cords of falsehood,/_and wickedness as with cart rope;

17759.text: /Who say, “Let him make speed, let him hasten his work, that we may see it;/_and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw near and come,/_that we may know it!”

17760.text: /Woe to those who call evil good, and good evil;/_who put darkness for light,/_and light for darkness;/who put bitter for sweet,/_and sweet for bitter!

17761.text: /Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes,/_and prudent in their own sight!

17762.text: /Woe to those who are mighty to drink wine,/_and champions at mixing strong drink;

17763.text: /who acquit the guilty for a bribe,/_but deny justice for the innocent!

17764.text: /Therefore as the tongue of fire devours the stubble,/_and as the dry grass sinks down in the flame,/_so their root shall be as rottenness,/_and their blossom shall go up as dust;/because they have rejected the law of Yahweh of Armies,/_and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

17765.text: /Therefore Yahweh’s anger burns against his people,/_and he has stretched out his hand against them, and has struck them./The mountains tremble,/_and their dead bodies are as refuse in the middle of the streets./For all this, his anger is not turned away,/_but his hand is still stretched out.

17766.text: /He will lift up a banner to the nations from far,/_and he will whistle for them from the end of the earth./_Behold, they will come speedily and swiftly.

17767.text: /No one shall be weary nor stumble among them;/_no one shall slumber nor sleep;/_neither shall the belt of their waist be untied,/_nor the strap of their sandals be broken:

17768.text: /whose arrows are sharp,/_and all their bows bent./Their horses’ hoofs will be like flint,/_and their wheels like a whirlwind.

17769.text: /Their roaring will be like a lioness./_They will roar like young lions./Yes, they shall roar,/_and seize their prey and carry it off,/_and there will be no one to deliver.

17770.text: /They will roar against them in that day like the roaring of the sea./_If one looks to the land behold, darkness and distress./_The light is darkened in its clouds.

17771.text: ¶In the year that king Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up; and his train filled the temple.

17772.text: Above him stood the seraphim. Each one had six wings. With two he covered his face. With two he covered his feet. With two he flew.

17773.text: One called to another, and said,¶▼“Holy, holy, holy, is Yahweh of Armies!/_The whole earth is full of his glory!”

17774.text: ¶The foundations of the thresholds shook at the voice of him who called, and the house was filled with smoke.

17775.text: Then I said, “Woe is me! For I am undone, because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell among a people of unclean lips: for my eyes have seen the King, Yahweh of Armies!”

17776.text: ¶Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar.

17777.text: He touched my mouth with it, and said, “Behold, this has touched your lips; and your iniquity is taken away, and your sin forgiven.”

17778.text: ¶I heard the Lord’s voice, saying, “Whom shall I send, and who will go for us?”¶Then I said, “Here I am. Send me!”

17779.text: ¶He said, “Go, and tell this people,¶▼‘You hear indeed,/_but don’t understand;/and you see indeed,/_but don’t perceive.’

17780.text: /Make the heart of this people fat./_Make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes;/lest they see with their eyes,/_and hear with their ears,/_and understand with their heart,/_and turn again, and be healed.”

17781.text: ¶Then I said, “Lord, how long?”¶He answered,¶▼“Until cities are waste without inhabitant,/_and houses without man,/_and the land becomes utterly waste,

17782.text: /_And Yahweh has removed men far away,/_and the forsaken places are many within the land.

17783.text: /If there is a tenth left in it,/_that also will in turn be consumed:/as a terebinth, and as an oak, whose stock remains when they are felled;/_so the holy seed is its stock.”

17784.text: ¶In the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.

17785.text: David’s house was told, “Syria is allied with Ephraim.” His heart trembled, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the forest tremble with the wind.

17786.text: Then Yahweh said to Isaiah, “Go out now to meet Ahaz, you, and Shearjashub your son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, on the highway of the fuller’s field.

17787.text: Tell him, ‘Be careful, and keep calm. Don’t be afraid, neither let your heart be faint because of these two tails of smoking torches, for the fierce anger of Rezin and Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.

17788.text: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have plotted evil against you, saying,

17789.text: “Let’s go up against Judah, and tear it apart, and let’s divide it among ourselves, and set up a king within it, even the son of Tabeel.”

17790.text: This is what the Lord Yahweh says: “It shall not stand, neither shall it happen.”

17791.text: For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin; and within sixty‑five years Ephraim shall be broken in pieces, so that it shall not be a people;

17792.text: and the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If you will not believe, surely you shall not be established.’”

17794.text: “Ask a sign of Yahweh your God; ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.”

17795.text: ¶But Ahaz said, “I will not ask, neither will I tempt Yahweh.”

17796.text: ¶He said, “Listen now, house of David. Is it not enough for you to try the patience of men, that you will try the patience of my God also?

17797.text: Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign. Behold, the virgin will conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.

17798.text: He shall eat butter and honey when he knows to refuse the evil, and choose the good.

17799.text: For before the child knows to refuse the evil, and choose the good, the land whose two kings you abhor shall be forsaken.

17800.text: Yahweh will bring on you, on your people, and on your father’s house, days that have not come, from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah; even the king of Assyria.

17801.text: It will happen in that day that Yahweh will whistle for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.

17802.text: They shall come, and shall all rest in the desolate valleys, in the clefts of the rocks, on all thorn hedges, and on all pastures.

17803.text: In that day the Lord will shave with a razor that is hired in the parts beyond the River, even with the king of Assyria, the head and the hair of the feet; and it shall also consume the beard.

17804.text: It shall happen in that day that a man shall keep alive a young cow, and two sheep;

17805.text: and it shall happen, that because of the abundance of milk which they shall give he shall eat butter: for everyone will eat butter and honey that is left within the land.

17806.text: It will happen in that day that every place where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silver shekels, shall be for briers and thorns.

17807.text: People will go there with arrows and with bow, because all the land will be briers and thorns.

17808.text: All the hills that were cultivated with the hoe, you shall not come there for fear of briers and thorns; but it shall be for the sending out of oxen, and for the treading of sheep.”

17809.text: ¶Yahweh said to me, “Take a large tablet, and write on it with a man’s pen, ‘For Maher Shalal Hash Baz’;

17810.text: and I will take for myself faithful witnesses to testify: Uriah the priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.”

17811.text: ¶I went to the prophetess, and she conceived, and bore a son. Then Yahweh said to me, “Call his name ‘Maher Shalal Hash Baz.’

17812.text: For before the child knows how to say, ‘My father,’ and, ‘My mother,’ the riches of Damascus and the plunder of Samaria will be carried away by the king of Assyria.”

17813.text: ¶Yahweh spoke to me yet again, saying,

17814.text: “Because this people have refused the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah’s son;

17815.text: now therefore, behold, the Lord brings upon them the mighty flood waters of the River: the king of Assyria and all his glory. It will come up over all its channels, and go over all its banks.

17816.text: It will sweep onward into Judah. It will overflow and pass through; it will reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of its wings will fill the width of your land, Immanuel.

17817.text: Make an uproar, you peoples, and be broken in pieces! Listen, all you from far countries: dress for battle, and be shattered! Dress for battle, and be shattered!

17818.text: Take counsel together, and it will be brought to nothing; speak the word, and it will not stand: for God is with us.”

17819.text: For Yahweh spoke thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me not to walk in the way of this people, saying,

17820.text: “Don’t say, ‘A conspiracy!’ concerning all about which this people say, ‘A conspiracy!’ neither fear their threats, nor be terrorized.

17821.text: Yahweh of Armies is who you must respect as holy. He is the one you must fear. He is the one you must dread.

17822.text: He will be a sanctuary, but for both houses of Israel, he will be a trap and a snare for the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

17823.text: Many will stumble over it, fall, be broken, be snared, and be captured.”

17824.text: Wrap up the testimony. Seal the law among my disciples.

17825.text: I will wait for Yahweh, who hides his face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for him.

17826.text: Behold, I and the children whom Yahweh has given me are for signs and for wonders in Israel from Yahweh of Armies, who dwells in Mount Zion.

17827.text: ¶When they tell you, “Consult with those who have familiar spirits and with the wizards, who chirp and who mutter:” shouldn’t a people consult with their God? Should they consult the dead on behalf of the living?

17828.text: Turn to the law and to the testimony! If they don’t speak according to this word, surely there is no morning for them.

17829.text: They will pass through it, very distressed and hungry; and it will happen that when they are hungry, they will worry, and curse by their king and by their God. They will turn their faces upward,

17830.text: and look to the earth, and see distress, darkness, and the gloom of anguish. They will be driven into thick darkness.

17831.text: ¶But there shall be no more gloom for her who was in anguish. In the former time, he brought into contempt the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali; but in the latter time he has made it glorious, by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations.

17832.text: ¶The people who walked in darkness have seen a great light.¶▼Those who lived in the land of the shadow of death, on them the light has shined.

17833.text: /You have multiplied the nation./_You have increased their joy.¶►They rejoice before you according to the joy in harvest, as men rejoice when they divide the plunder.

17834.text: For the yoke of his burden, and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his oppressor, you have broken as in the day of Midian.

17835.text: For all the armor of the armed man in the noisy battle, and the garments rolled in blood, will be for burning, fuel for the fire.

17836.text: For to us a child is born. To us a son is given; and the government will be on his shoulders. His name will be called Wonderful, Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.

17837.text: Of the increase of his government and of peace there shall be no end, on David’s throne, and on his kingdom, to establish it, and to uphold it with justice and with righteousness from that time on, even forever. The zeal of Yahweh of Armies will perform this.

17838.text: ¶The Lord sent a word into Jacob,¶▼and it falls on Israel.

17839.text: /All the people will know,/_including Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria, who say in pride and in arrogance of heart,

17840.text: /“The bricks have fallen,/_but we will build with cut stone./The sycamore fig trees have been cut down,/_but we will put cedars in their place.”

17841.text: /Therefore Yahweh will set up on high against him the adversaries of Rezin,/_and will stir up his enemies,

17842.text: /_The Syrians in front,/_and the Philistines behind;/_and they will devour Israel with open mouth./For all this, his anger is not turned away,/_but his hand is stretched out still.

17843.text: /Yet the people have not turned to him who struck them,/_neither have they sought Yahweh of Armies.

17844.text: /Therefore Yahweh will cut off from Israel head and tail,/_palm branch and reed, in one day.

17845.text: /The elder and the honorable man is the head,/_and the prophet who teaches lies is the tail.

17846.text: /For those who lead this people lead them astray;/_and those who are led by them are destroyed.

17847.text: /Therefore the Lord will not rejoice over their young men,/_neither will he have compassion on their fatherless and widows;/for everyone is profane and an evildoer,/_and every mouth speaks folly./For all this his anger is not turned away,/_but his hand is stretched out still.

17848.text: /For wickedness burns like a fire./_It devours the briers and thorns;/_yes, it kindles in the thickets of the forest,/_and they roll upward in a column of smoke.

17849.text: /Through Yahweh of Armies’ wrath, the land is burnt up;/_and the people are the fuel for the fire./_No one spares his brother.

17850.text: /One will devour on the right hand, and be hungry;/_and he will eat on the left hand, and they will not be satisfied./Everyone will eat the flesh of his own arm:

17851.text: /_Manasseh, Ephraim; and Ephraim, Manasseh; and they together shall be against Judah./For all this his anger is not turned away,/_but his hand is stretched out still.

17852.text: ¶Woe to those who decree unrighteous decrees, and to the writers who write oppressive decrees;

17853.text: to deprive the needy from justice, and to rob the poor among my people of their rights, that widows may be their plunder, and that they may make the fatherless their prey!

17854.text: What will you do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which will come from afar? To whom will you flee for help? Where will you leave your wealth?

17855.text: ¶They will only bow down under the prisoners,¶▼and will fall under the slain./For all this his anger is not turned away,/_but his hand is stretched out still.

17856.text: ¶Alas Assyrian, the rod of my anger, the staff in whose hand is my indignation!

17857.text: I will send him against a profane nation, and against the people who anger me will I give him a command to take the plunder and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.

17858.text: However he doesn’t mean so, neither does his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy, and to cut off not a few nations.

17859.text: For he says, “Aren’t all of my princes kings?

17860.text: Isn’t Calno like Carchemish? Isn’t Hamath like Arpad? Isn’t Samaria like Damascus?”

17861.text: As my hand has found the kingdoms of the idols, whose engraved images exceeded those of Jerusalem and of Samaria;

17862.text: shall I not, as I have done to Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?

17863.text: Therefore it will happen that, when the Lord has performed his whole work on Mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the willful proud heart of the king of Assyria, and the insolence of his haughty looks.

17864.text: For he has said, “By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom; for I have understanding: and I have removed the boundaries of the peoples, and have robbed their treasures. Like a valiant man I have brought down their rulers.

17865.text: My hand has found the riches of the peoples like a nest, and like one gathers eggs that are abandoned, have I gathered all the earth. There was no one who moved their wing, or that opened their mouth, or chirped.”

17866.text: ¶Should an ax brag against him who chops with it? Should a saw exalt itself above him who saws with it? As if a rod should lift those who lift it up, or as if a staff should lift up someone who is not wood.

17867.text: Therefore the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, will send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory a burning will be kindled like the burning of fire.

17868.text: The light of Israel will be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame; and it will burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day.

17869.text: He will consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body. It will be as when a standard bearer faints.

17870.text: The remnant of the trees of his forest shall be few, so that a child could write their number.

17871.text: ¶It will come to pass in that day that the remnant of Israel, and those who have escaped from the house of Jacob will no more again lean on him who struck them, but shall lean on Yahweh, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.

17872.text: A remnant will return, even the remnant of Jacob, to the mighty God.

17873.text: For though your people, Israel, are like the sand of the sea, only a remnant of them will return. A destruction is determined, overflowing with righteousness.

17874.text: For the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, will make a full end, and that determined, throughout all the earth.

17875.text: Therefore the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, says “My people who dwell in Zion, don’t be afraid of the Assyrian, though he strike you with the rod, and lift up his staff against you, as Egypt did.

17876.text: For yet a very little while, and the indignation against you will be accomplished, and my anger will be directed to his destruction.”

17877.text: Yahweh of Armies will stir up a scourge against him, as in the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb. His rod will be over the sea, and he will lift it up like he did against Egypt.

17878.text: It will happen in that day, that his burden will depart from off your shoulder, and his yoke from off your neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing oil.

17879.text: ¶He has come to Aiath. He has passed through Migron. At Michmash he stores his baggage.

17880.text: They have gone over the pass. They have taken up their lodging at Geba. Ramah trembles. Gibeah of Saul has fled.

17881.text: Cry aloud with your voice, daughter of Gallim! Listen, Laishah! You poor Anathoth!

17882.text: Madmenah is a fugitive. The inhabitants of Gebim flee for safety.

17883.text: This very day he will halt at Nob. He shakes his hand at the mountain of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.

17884.text: Behold, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, will lop the boughs with terror. The tall will be cut down, and the lofty will be brought low.

17885.text: He will cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon will fall by the Mighty One.

17886.text: ¶A shoot will come out of the stock of Jesse,/_and a branch out of his roots will bear fruit.

17887.text: /Yahweh’s Spirit will rest on him:/_the spirit of wisdom and understanding,/_the spirit of counsel and might,/_the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of Yahweh.

17888.text: /His delight will be in the fear of Yahweh./He will not judge by the sight of his eyes,/_neither decide by the hearing of his ears;

17889.text: /but with righteousness he will judge the poor,/_and decide with equity for the humble of the earth./He will strike the earth with the rod of his mouth;/_and with the breath of his lips he will kill the wicked.

17890.text: /Righteousness will be the belt of his waist,/_and faithfulness the belt of his waist.

17891.text: /The wolf will live with the lamb,/_and the leopard will lie down with the young goat;/_The calf, the young lion, and the fattened calf together;/_and a little child will lead them.

17892.text: /The cow and the bear will graze./_Their young ones will lie down together./_The lion will eat straw like the ox.

17893.text: /The nursing child will play near a cobra’s hole,/_and the weaned child will put his hand on the viper’s den.

17894.text: /They will not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain;/_for the earth will be full of the knowledge of Yahweh,/_as the waters cover the sea.

17895.text: ¶It will happen in that day that the nations will seek the root of Jesse, who stands as a banner of the peoples; and his resting place will be glorious.

17896.text: It will happen in that day that the Lord will set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant that is left of his people from Assyria, from Egypt, from Pathros, from Cush, from Elam, from Shinar, from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.

17897.text: He will set up a banner for the nations, and will assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.

17898.text: The envy also of Ephraim will depart, and those who persecute Judah will be cut off. Ephraim won’t envy Judah, and Judah won’t persecute Ephraim.

17899.text: They will fly down on the shoulders of the Philistines on the west. Together they will plunder the children of the east. They will extend their power over Edom and Moab, and the children of Ammon will obey them.

17900.text: Yahweh will utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his scorching wind he will wave his hand over the River, and will split it into seven streams, and cause men to march over in sandals.

17901.text: There will be a highway for the remnant that is left of his people from Assyria, like there was for Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.

17902.text: ¶In that day you will say, “I will give thanks to you, Yahweh; for though you were angry with me, your anger has turned away and you comfort me.

17903.text: Behold, God is my salvation. I will trust, and will not be afraid; for Yah, Yahweh, is my strength and song; and he has become my salvation.”

17904.text: Therefore with joy you will draw water out of the wells of salvation.

17905.text: In that day you will say, “Give thanks to Yahweh! Call on his name. Declare his doings among the peoples. Proclaim that his name is exalted!

17906.text: Sing to Yahweh, for he has done excellent things! Let this be known in all the earth!

17907.text: Cry aloud and shout, you inhabitant of Zion; for the Holy One of Israel is great among you!”

17908.text: ¶The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz saw:

17909.text: Set up a banner on the bare mountain! Lift up your voice to them! Wave your hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.

17910.text: I have commanded my consecrated ones; yes, I have called my mighty men for my anger, even my proudly exulting ones.

17911.text: The noise of a multitude is in the mountains, as of a great people; the noise of an uproar of the kingdoms of the nations gathered together! Yahweh of Armies is mustering the army for the battle.

17912.text: They come from a far country, from the uttermost part of heaven, even Yahweh, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.

17913.text: Wail; for the day of Yahweh is at hand! It will come as destruction from the Almighty.

17914.text: Therefore all hands will be feeble, and everyone’s heart will melt.

17915.text: They will be dismayed. Pangs and sorrows will seize them. They will be in pain like a woman in labor. They will look in amazement one at another. Their faces will be faces of flame.

17916.text: Behold, the day of Yahweh comes, cruel, with wrath and fierce anger; to make the land a desolation, and to destroy its sinners out of it.

17917.text: For the stars of the sky and its constellations will not give their light. The sun will be darkened in its going out, and the moon will not cause its light to shine.

17918.text: I will punish the world for their evil, and the wicked for their iniquity. I will cause the arrogance of the proud to cease, and will humble the haughtiness of the terrible.

17919.text: I will make people more rare than fine gold, even a person than the pure gold of Ophir.

17920.text: Therefore I will make the heavens tremble, and the earth will be shaken out of its place in Yahweh of Armies’ wrath, and in the day of his fierce anger.

17921.text: It will happen that like a hunted gazelle, and like sheep that no one gathers, they will each turn to their own people, and will each flee to their own land.

17922.text: Everyone who is found will be thrust through. Everyone who is captured will fall by the sword.

17923.text: Their infants also will be dashed in pieces before their eyes. Their houses will be ransacked, and their wives raped.

17924.text: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, who will not value silver, and as for gold, they will not delight in it.

17925.text: Their bows will dash the young men in pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb. Their eyes will not spare children.

17926.text: Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldeans’ pride, will be like when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.

17927.text: It will never be inhabited, neither will it be lived in from generation to generation. The Arabian will not pitch a tent there, neither will shepherds make their flocks lie down there.

17928.text: But wild animals of the desert will lie there, and their houses will be full of jackals. Ostriches will dwell there, and wild goats will frolic there.

17929.text: Wolves will cry in their fortresses, and jackals in the pleasant palaces. Her time is near to come, and her days will not be prolonged.

17930.text: ¶For Yahweh will have compassion on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in their own land. The foreigner will join himself with them, and they will unite with the house of Jacob.

17931.text: The peoples will take them, and bring them to their place. The house of Israel will possess them in Yahweh’s land for servants and for handmaids. They will take as captives those whose captives they were; and they shall rule over their oppressors.

17932.text: It will happen in the day that Yahweh will give you rest from your sorrow, from your trouble, and from the hard service in which you were made to serve,

17933.text: that you will take up this parable against the king of Babylon, and say, “How the oppressor has ceased! The golden city has ceased!”

17934.text: Yahweh has broken the staff of the wicked, the scepter of the rulers,

17935.text: who struck the peoples in wrath with a continual stroke, who ruled the nations in anger, with a persecution that no one restrained.

17936.text: The whole earth is at rest, and is quiet. They break out song.

17937.text: Yes, the cypress trees rejoice with you, with the cedars of Lebanon, saying, “Since you are humbled, no lumberjack has come up against us.”

17938.text: Sheol from beneath has moved for you to meet you at your coming. It stirs up the departed spirits for you, even all the rulers of the earth. It has raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.

17939.text: They all will answer and ask you, “Have you also become as weak as we are? Have you become like us?”

17940.text: Your pomp is brought down to Sheol, with the sound of your stringed instruments. Maggots are spread out under you, and worms cover you.

17941.text: ¶How you have fallen from heaven, morning star, son of the dawn! How you are cut down to the ground, who laid the nations low!

17942.text: You said in your heart, “I will ascend into heaven! I will exalt my throne above the stars of God! I will sit on the mountain of assembly, in the far north!

17943.text: I will ascend above the heights of the clouds! I will make myself like the Most High!”

17944.text: Yet you shall be brought down to Sheol, to the depths of the pit.

17945.text: Those who see you will stare at you. They will ponder you, saying, “Is this the man who made the earth to tremble, who shook kingdoms;

17946.text: who made the world like a wilderness, and overthrew its cities; who didn’t release his prisoners to their home?”

17947.text: ¶All the kings of the nations, sleep in glory, everyone in his own house.

17948.text: But you are cast away from your tomb like an abominable branch, clothed with the slain, who are thrust through with the sword, who go down to the stones of the pit; like a dead body trodden under foot.

17949.text: You will not join them in burial, because you have destroyed your land. You have killed your people. The offspring of evildoers will not be named forever.

17950.text: Prepare for slaughter of his children because of the iniquity of their fathers, that they not rise up and possess the earth, and fill the surface of the world with cities.

17951.text: “I will rise up against them,” says Yahweh of Armies, “and cut off from Babylon name and remnant, and son and son’s son,” says Yahweh.

17952.text: “I will also make it a possession for the porcupine, and pools of water. I will sweep it with the broom of destruction,” says Yahweh of Armies.

17953.text: Yahweh of Armies has sworn, saying, “Surely, as I have thought, so shall it happen; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand:

17954.text: that I will break the Assyrian in my land, and tread him under foot on my mountains. Then his yoke will leave them, and his burden leave their shoulders.

17955.text: This is the plan that is determined for the whole earth. This is the hand that is stretched out over all the nations.

17956.text: For Yahweh of Armies has planned, and who can stop it? His hand is stretched out, and who can turn it back?”

17957.text: ¶This burden was in the year that king Ahaz died.

17958.text: Don’t rejoice, O Philistia, all of you, because the rod that struck you is broken; for out of the serpent’s root an adder will emerge, and his fruit will be a fiery flying serpent.

17959.text: The firstborn of the poor will eat, and the needy will lie down in safety; and I will kill your root with famine, and your remnant will be killed.

17960.text: ¶Howl, gate! Cry, city! You are melted away, Philistia, all of you; for smoke comes out of the north, and there is no straggler in his ranks.

17961.text: What will they answer the messengers of the nation? That Yahweh has founded Zion, and in her the afflicted of his people will take refuge.

17962.text: ¶The burden of Moab: for in a night, Ar of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nothing; for in a night Kir of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nothing.

17963.text: They have gone up to Bayith, and to Dibon, to the high places, to weep. Moab wails over Nebo and over Medeba. Baldness is on all of their heads. Every beard is cut off.

17964.text: In their streets, they clothe themselves in sackcloth. In their streets and on their housetops, everyone wails, weeping abundantly.

17965.text: Heshbon cries out with Elealeh. Their voice is heard even to Jahaz. Therefore the armed men of Moab cry aloud. Their souls tremble within them.

17966.text: My heart cries out for Moab! Her nobles flee to Zoar, to Eglath Shelishiyah; for they go up by the ascent of Luhith with weeping; for on the way to Horonaim, they raise up a cry of destruction.

17967.text: For the waters of Nimrim will be desolate; for the grass has withered away, the tender grass fails, there is no green thing.

17968.text: Therefore they will carry away the abundance they have gotten, and that which they have stored up, over the brook of the willows.

17969.text: For the cry has gone around the borders of Moab; its wailing to Eglaim, and its wailing to Beer Elim.

17970.text: For the waters of Dimon are full of blood; for I will bring yet more on Dimon, a lion on those of Moab who escape, and on the remnant of the land.

17971.text: ¶Send the lambs for the ruler of the land from Selah to the wilderness, to the mountain of the daughter of Zion.

17972.text: For it will be that as wandering birds, as a scattered nest, so will the daughters of Moab be at the fords of the Arnon.

17973.text: Give counsel! Execute justice! Make your shade like the night in the middle of the noonday! Hide the outcasts! Don’t betray the fugitive!

17974.text: Let my outcasts dwell with you! As for Moab, be a hiding place for him from the face of the destroyer. For the extortionist is brought to nothing. Destruction ceases. The oppressors are consumed out of the land.

17975.text: A throne will be established in loving kindness. One will sit on it in truth, in the tent of David, judging, seeking justice, and swift to do righteousness.

17976.text: ¶We have heard of the pride of Moab, that he is very proud; even of his arrogance, his pride, and his wrath. His boastings are nothing.

17977.text: Therefore Moab will wail for Moab. Everyone will wail. You will mourn for the raisin cakes of Kir Hareseth, utterly stricken.

17978.text: For the fields of Heshbon languish with the vine of Sibmah. The lords of the nations have broken down its choice branches, which reached even to Jazer, which wandered into the wilderness. Its shoots were spread abroad. They passed over the sea.

17979.text: Therefore I will weep with the weeping of Jazer for the vine of Sibmah. I will water you with my tears, Heshbon, and Elealeh: for on your summer fruits and on your harvest the battle shout has fallen.

17980.text: Gladness is taken away, and joy out of the fruitful field; and in the vineyards there will be no singing, neither joyful noise. Nobody will tread out wine in the presses. I have made the shouting stop.

17981.text: Therefore my heart sounds like a harp for Moab, and my inward parts for Kir Heres.

17982.text: It will happen that when Moab presents himself, when he wearies himself on the high place, and comes to his sanctuary to pray, that he will not prevail.

17983.text: This is the word that Yahweh spoke concerning Moab in time past.

17984.text: But now Yahweh has spoken, saying, “Within three years, as a worker bound by contract would count them, the glory of Moab shall be brought into contempt, with all his great multitude; and the remnant will be very small and feeble.”

17985.text: ¶The burden of Damascus: “Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, and it will be a ruinous heap.

17986.text: The cities of Aroer are forsaken. They will be for flocks, which shall lie down, and no one shall make them afraid.

17987.text: The fortress shall cease from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus, and the remnant of Syria. They will be as the glory of the children of Israel,” says Yahweh of Armies.

17988.text: “It will happen in that day that the glory of Jacob will be made thin, and the fatness of his flesh will become lean.

17989.text: It will be like when the harvester gathers the wheat, and his arm reaps the grain. Yes, it will be like when one gleans grain in the valley of Rephaim.

17990.text: Yet gleanings will be left there, like the shaking of an olive tree, two or three olives in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the outermost branches of a fruitful tree,” says Yahweh, the God of Israel.

17991.text: In that day, people will look to their Maker, and their eyes will have respect for the Holy One of Israel.

17992.text: They will not look to the altars, the work of their hands; neither shall they respect that which their fingers have made, either the Asherah poles, or the incense altars.

17993.text: In that day, their strong cities will be like the forsaken places in the woods and on the mountain top, which were forsaken from before the children of Israel; and it will be a desolation.

17994.text: For you have forgotten the God of your salvation, and have not remembered the rock of your strength. Therefore you plant pleasant plants, and set out foreign seedlings.

17995.text: In the day of your planting, you hedge it in. In the morning, you make your seed blossom, but the harvest flees away in the day of grief and of desperate sorrow.

17996.text: Ah, the uproar of many peoples, who roar like the roaring of the seas; and the rushing of nations, that rush like the rushing of mighty waters!

17997.text: The nations will rush like the rushing of many waters: but he will rebuke them, and they will flee far off, and will be chased like the chaff of the mountains before the wind, and like the whirling dust before the storm.

17998.text: At evening, behold, terror! Before the morning, they are no more. This is the portion of those who plunder us, and the lot of those who rob us.

17999.text: ¶Ah, the land of the rustling of wings, which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia;

18000.text: that sends ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of papyrus on the waters, saying, “Go, you swift messengers, to a nation tall and smooth, to a people awesome from their beginning onward, a nation that measures out and treads down, whose land the rivers divide!”

18001.text: All you inhabitants of the world, and you dwellers on the earth, when a banner is lifted up on the mountains, look! When the trumpet is blown, listen!

18002.text: For Yahweh said to me, “I will be still, and I will see in my dwelling place, like clear heat in sunshine, like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.”

18003.text: For before the harvest, when the blossom is over, and the flower becomes a ripening grape, he will cut off the sprigs with pruning hooks, and he will cut down and take away the spreading branches.

18004.text: They will be left together for the ravenous birds of the mountains, and for the animals of the earth. The ravenous birds will summer on them, and all the animals of the earth will winter on them.

18005.text: In that time, a present will be brought to Yahweh of Armies from a people tall and smooth, even from a people awesome from their beginning onward, a nation that measures out and treads down, whose land the rivers divide, to the place of the name of Yahweh of Armies, Mount Zion.

18006.text: ¶The burden of Egypt: “Behold, Yahweh rides on a swift cloud, and comes to Egypt. The idols of Egypt will tremble at his presence; and the heart of Egypt will melt within it.

18007.text: I will stir up the Egyptians against the Egyptians, and they will fight everyone against his brother, and everyone against his neighbor; city against city, and kingdom against kingdom.

18008.text: The spirit of Egypt will fail within it. I will destroy its counsel. They will seek the idols, the charmers, those who have familiar spirits, and the wizards.

18009.text: I will give over the Egyptians into the hand of a cruel lord. A fierce king will rule over them,” says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies.

18010.text: The waters will fail from the sea, and the river will be wasted and become dry.

18011.text: The rivers will become foul. The streams of Egypt will be diminished and dried up. The reeds and flags will wither away.

18012.text: The meadows by the Nile, by the brink of the Nile, and all the sown fields of the Nile, will become dry, be driven away, and be no more.

18013.text: The fishermen will lament, and all those who fish in the Nile will mourn, and those who spread nets on the waters will languish.

18014.text: Moreover those who work in combed flax, and those who weave white cloth, will be confounded.

18015.text: The pillars will be broken in pieces. All those who work for hire will be grieved in soul.

18016.text: The princes of Zoan are utterly foolish. The counsel of the wisest counselors of Pharaoh has become stupid. How do you say to Pharaoh, “I am the son of the wise, the son of ancient kings?”

18017.text: Where then are your wise men? Let them tell you now; and let them know what Yahweh of Armies has purposed concerning Egypt.

18018.text: The princes of Zoan have become fools. The princes of Memphis are deceived. They have caused Egypt to go astray, who are the cornerstone of her tribes.

18019.text: Yahweh has mixed a spirit of perverseness in the middle of her; and they have caused Egypt to go astray in all of its works, like a drunken man staggers in his vomit.

18020.text: Neither shall there be any work for Egypt, which head or tail, palm branch or rush, may do.

18021.text: In that day the Egyptians will be like women. They will tremble and fear because of the shaking of Yahweh of Armies’s hand, which he shakes over them.

18022.text: The land of Judah will become a terror to Egypt. Everyone to whom mention is made of it will be afraid, because of the plans of Yahweh of Armies, which he determines against it.

18023.text: In that day, there will be five cities in the land of Egypt that speak the language of Canaan, and swear to Yahweh of Armies. One will be called “The city of destruction.”

18024.text: In that day, there will be an altar to Yahweh in the middle of the land of Egypt, and a pillar to Yahweh at its border.

18025.text: It will be for a sign and for a witness to Yahweh of Armies in the land of Egypt; for they will cry to Yahweh because of oppressors, and he will send them a savior and a defender, and he will deliver them.

18026.text: Yahweh will be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians will know Yahweh in that day. Yes, they will worship with sacrifice and offering, and will vow a vow to Yahweh, and will perform it.

18027.text: Yahweh will strike Egypt, striking and healing. They will return to Yahweh, and he will be entreated by them, and will heal them.

18028.text: In that day there will be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian shall come into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria; and the Egyptians will worship with the Assyrians.

18029.text: In that day, Israel will be the third with Egypt and with Assyria, a blessing within the earth;

18030.text: because Yahweh of Armies has blessed them, saying, “Blessed be Egypt my people, Assyria the work of my hands, and Israel my inheritance.”

18031.text: ¶In the year that Tartan came to Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and took it;

18032.text: at that time Yahweh spoke by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, “Go, and loosen the sackcloth from off your waist, and take your shoes from off your feet.” He did so, walking naked and barefoot.

18033.text: Yahweh said, “As my servant Isaiah has walked naked and barefoot three years for a sign and a wonder concerning Egypt and concerning Ethiopia,

18034.text: so the king of Assyria will lead away the captives of Egypt and the exiles of Ethiopia, young and old, naked and barefoot, and with buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.

18035.text: They will be dismayed and confounded, because of Ethiopia their expectation, and of Egypt their glory.

18036.text: The inhabitants of this coast land will say in that day, ‘Behold, this is our expectation, where we fled for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria. And we, how will we escape?’”

18037.text: ¶The burden of the wilderness of the sea. As whirlwinds in the South sweep through, it comes from the wilderness, from an awesome land.

18038.text: A grievous vision is declared to me. The treacherous man deals treacherously, and the destroyer destroys. Go up, Elam; attack! I have stopped all of Media’s sighing.

18039.text: Therefore my thighs are filled with anguish. Pains have taken hold on me, like the pains of a woman in labor. I am in so much pain that I can’t hear. I so am dismayed that I can’t see.

18040.text: My heart flutters. Horror has frightened me. The twilight that I desired has been turned into trembling for me.

18041.text: They prepare the table. They set the watch. They eat. They drink. Rise up, you princes, oil the shield!

18042.text: For the Lord said to me, “Go, set a watchman. Let him declare what he sees.

18043.text: When he sees a troop, horsemen in pairs, a troop of donkeys, a troop of camels, he shall listen diligently with great attentiveness.”

18044.text: He cried like a lion: “Lord, I stand continually on the watchtower in the daytime, and every night I stay at my post.

18045.text: Behold, here comes a troop of men, horsemen in pairs.” He answered, “Fallen, fallen is Babylon; and all the engraved images of her gods are broken to the ground.

18046.text: You are my threshing, and the grain of my floor!” That which I have heard from Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, I have declared to you.

18047.text: ¶The burden of Dumah. One calls to me out of Seir, “Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?”

18048.text: The watchman said, “The morning comes, and also the night. If you will inquire, inquire. Come back again.”

18049.text: ¶The burden on Arabia. In the forest in Arabia you will lodge, you caravans of Dedanites.

18050.text: They brought water to him who was thirsty. The inhabitants of the land of Tema met the fugitives with their bread.

18051.text: For they fled away from the swords, from the drawn sword, from the bent bow, and from the heat of battle.

18052.text: For the Lord said to me, “Within a year, as a worker bound by contract would count it, all the glory of Kedar will fail,

18053.text: and the residue of the number of the archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, will be few; for Yahweh, the God of Israel, has spoken it.”

18054.text: ¶The burden of the valley of vision. What ails you now, that you have all gone up to the housetops?

18055.text: You that are full of shouting, a tumultuous city, a joyous town; your slain are not slain with the sword, neither are they dead in battle.

18056.text: All your rulers fled away together. They were bound by the archers. All who were found by you were bound together. They fled far away.

18057.text: Therefore I said, “Look away from me. I will weep bitterly. Don’t labor to comfort me for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

18058.text: For it is a day of confusion, and of treading down, and of perplexity, from the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, in the valley of vision; a breaking down of the walls, and a crying to the mountains.”

18059.text: Elam carried his quiver, with chariots of men and horsemen; and Kir uncovered the shield.

18060.text: Your choicest valleys were full of chariots, and the horsemen set themselves in array at the gate.

18061.text: He took away the covering of Judah; and you looked in that day to the armor in the house of the forest.

18062.text: You saw the breaches of David’s city, that they were many; and you gathered together the waters of the lower pool.

18063.text: You numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and you broke down the houses to fortify the wall.

18064.text: You also made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you didn’t look to him who had done this, neither did you have respect for him who purposed it long ago.

18065.text: In that day, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, called to weeping, and to mourning, and to baldness, and to dressing in sackcloth:

18066.text: and behold, joy and gladness, killing cattle and killing sheep, eating flesh and drinking wine: “Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we will die.”

18067.text: Yahweh of Armies revealed himself in my ears, “Surely this iniquity will not be forgiven you until you die,” says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies.

18068.text: ¶Thus says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, “Go, get yourself to this treasurer, even to Shebna, who is over the house, and say,

18069.text: ‘What are you doing here? Who has you here, that you have dug out a tomb here?’ Cutting himself out a tomb on high, chiseling a habitation for himself in the rock!”

18070.text: Behold, Yahweh will overcome you and hurl you away violently. Yes, he will grasp you firmly.

18071.text: He will surely wind you around and around, and throw you like a ball into a large country. There you will die, and there the chariots of your glory will be, you shame of your lord’s house.

18072.text: I will thrust you from your office. You will be pulled down from your station.

18073.text: ¶It will happen in that day that I will call my servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah,

18074.text: and I will clothe him with your robe, and strengthen him with your belt. I will commit your government into his hand; and he will be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah.

18075.text: I will lay the key of David’s house on his shoulder. He will open, and no one will shut. He will shut, and no one will open.

18076.text: I will fasten him like a nail in a sure place. He will be for a throne of glory to his father’s house.

18077.text: They will hang on him all the glory of his father’s house, the offspring and the issue, every small vessel, from the cups even to all the pitchers.

18078.text: “In that day,” says Yahweh of Armies, “the nail that was fastened in a sure place will give way. It will be cut down, and fall. The burden that was on it will be cut off, for Yahweh has spoken it.”

18079.text: ¶The burden of Tyre. Howl, you ships of Tarshish! For it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in. From the land of Kittim it is revealed to them.

18080.text: Be still, you inhabitants of the coast, you whom the merchants of Sidon, that pass over the sea, have replenished.

18081.text: On great waters, the seed of the Shihor, the harvest of the Nile, was her revenue. She was the market of nations.

18082.text: Be ashamed, Sidon; for the sea has spoken, the stronghold of the sea, saying, “I have not travailed, nor given birth, neither have I nourished young men, nor brought up virgins.”

18083.text: When the report comes to Egypt, they will be in anguish at the report of Tyre.

18084.text: Pass over to Tarshish! Wail, you inhabitants of the coast!

18085.text: Is this your joyous city, whose antiquity is of ancient days, whose feet carried her far away to travel?

18086.text: Who has planned this against Tyre, the giver of crowns, whose merchants are princes, whose traffickers are the honorable of the earth?

18087.text: Yahweh of Armies has planned it, to stain the pride of all glory, to bring into contempt all the honorable of the earth.

18088.text: Pass through your land like the Nile, daughter of Tarshish. There is no restraint any more.

18089.text: He has stretched out his hand over the sea. He has shaken the kingdoms. Yahweh has ordered the destruction of Canaan’s strongholds.

18090.text: He said, “You shall rejoice no more, you oppressed virgin daughter of Sidon. Arise, pass over to Kittim. Even there you will have no rest.”

18091.text: ¶Behold, the land of the Chaldeans. This people was not. The Assyrians founded it for those who dwell in the wilderness. They set up their towers. They overthrew its palaces. They made it a ruin.

18092.text: Howl, you ships of Tarshish, for your stronghold is laid waste!

18093.text: It will come to pass in that day that Tyre will be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king. After the end of seventy years it will be to Tyre like in the song of the prostitute.

18094.text: Take a harp; go about the city, you prostitute that has been forgotten. Make sweet melody. Sing many songs, that you may be remembered.

18095.text: It will happen after the end of seventy years that Yahweh will visit Tyre, and she shall return to her wages, and will play the prostitute with all the kingdoms of the world on the surface of the earth.

18096.text: Her merchandise and her wages will be holiness to Yahweh. It will not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise will be for those who dwell before Yahweh, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing.

18097.text: ¶Behold, Yahweh makes the earth empty, makes it waste, turns it upside down, and scatters its inhabitants.

18098.text: It will be as with the people, so with the priest; as with the servant, so with his master; as with the maid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the creditor, so with the debtor; as with the taker of interest, so with the giver of interest.

18099.text: The earth will be utterly emptied and utterly laid waste; for Yahweh has spoken this word.

18100.text: The earth mourns and fades away. The world languishes and fades away. The lofty people of the earth languish.

18101.text: The earth also is polluted under its inhabitants, because they have transgressed the laws, violated the statutes, and broken the everlasting covenant.

18102.text: Therefore the curse has devoured the earth, and those who dwell therein are found guilty. Therefore the inhabitants of the earth are burned, and few men left.

18103.text: The new wine mourns. The vine languishes. All the merry‑hearted sigh.

18104.text: The mirth of tambourines ceases. The sound of those who rejoice ends. The joy of the harp ceases.

18105.text: They will not drink wine with a song. Strong drink will be bitter to those who drink it.

18106.text: The confused city is broken down. Every house is shut up, that no man may come in.

18107.text: There is a crying in the streets because of the wine. All joy is darkened. The mirth of the land is gone.

18108.text: The city is left in desolation, and the gate is struck with destruction.

18109.text: For it will be so within the earth among the peoples, as the shaking of an olive tree, as the gleanings when the vintage is done.

18110.text: These shall lift up their voice. They will shout for the majesty of Yahweh. They cry aloud from the sea.

18111.text: Therefore glorify Yahweh in the east, even the name of Yahweh, the God of Israel, in the islands of the sea!

18112.text: From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs. Glory to the righteous! But I said, “I pine away! I pine away! woe is me!” The treacherous have dealt treacherously. Yes, the treacherous have dealt very treacherously.

18113.text: Fear, the pit, and the snare, are on you who inhabitant the earth.

18114.text: It will happen that he who flees from the noise of the fear will fall into the pit; and he who comes up out of the middle of the pit will be taken in the snare; for the windows on high are opened, and the foundations of the earth tremble.

18115.text: The earth is utterly broken. The earth is torn apart. The earth is shaken violently.

18116.text: The earth will stagger like a drunken man, and will sway back and forth like a hammock. Its disobedience will be heavy on it, and it will fall and not rise again.

18117.text: It shall happen in that day that Yahweh will punish the army of the high ones on high, and the kings of the earth on the earth.

18118.text: They shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit, and shall be shut up in the prison; and after many days shall they be visited.

18119.text: Then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed; for Yahweh of Armies will reign on Mount Zion, and in Jerusalem; and before his elders will be glory.

18120.text: ¶Yahweh, you are my God. I will exalt you! I will praise your name, for you have done wonderful things, things planned long ago, in complete faithfulness and truth.

18121.text: For you have made a city into a heap, a fortified city into a ruin, a palace of strangers to be no city. It will never be built.

18122.text: Therefore a strong people will glorify you. A city of awesome nations will fear you.

18123.text: For you have been a stronghold to the poor, a stronghold to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shade from the heat, when the blast of the dreaded ones is like a storm against the wall.

18124.text: As the heat in a dry place will you bring down the noise of strangers; as the heat by the shade of a cloud, the song of the dreaded ones will be brought low.

18125.text: In this mountain, Yahweh of Armies will make all peoples a feast of fat things, a feast of choice wines, of fat things full of marrow, of well refined choice wines.

18126.text: He will destroy in this mountain the surface of the covering that covers all peoples, and the veil that is spread over all nations.

18127.text: He has swallowed up death forever! The Lord Yahweh will wipe away tears from off all faces. He will take the reproach of his people away from off all the earth, for Yahweh has spoken it.

18128.text: It shall be said in that day, “Behold, this is our God! We have waited for him, and he will save us! This is Yahweh! We have waited for him. We will be glad and rejoice in his salvation!”

18129.text: For in this mountain Yahweh’s hand will rest.¶Moab will be trodden down in his place, even like straw is trodden down in the water of the dunghill.

18130.text: He will spread out his hands in the middle of it, like one who swims spreads out hands to swim, but his pride will be humbled together with the craft of his hands.

18131.text: He has brought the high fortress of your walls down, laid low, and brought to the ground, even to the dust.

18132.text: ¶In that day, this song will be sung in the land of Judah:¶▼“We have a strong city./_God appoints salvation for walls and bulwarks.

18133.text: /Open the gates, that the righteous nation may enter:/_the one which keeps faith.

18134.text: /You will keep whoever’s mind is steadfast in perfect peace,/_because he trusts in you.

18135.text: /Trust in Yahweh forever;/_for in Yah, Yahweh, is an everlasting Rock.

18136.text: /For he has brought down those who dwell on high, the lofty city./_He lays it low./_He lays it low even to the ground./_He brings it even to the dust.

18137.text: /The foot shall tread it down;/_Even the feet of the poor,/_and the steps of the needy.”

18138.text: /The way of the just is uprightness./_You who are upright make the path of the righteous level.

18139.text: /Yes, in the way of your judgments, Yahweh, have we waited for you. Your name and your renown are the desire of our soul.

18140.text: /With my soul have I desired you in the night. Yes, with my spirit within me will I seek you earnestly; for when your judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.

18141.text: /Let favor be shown to the wicked, yet he will not learn righteousness. In the land of uprightness he will deal wrongfully, and will not see Yahweh’s majesty.

18142.text: /Yahweh, your hand is lifted up, yet they don’t see; but they will see your zeal for the people, and be disappointed. Yes, fire will consume your adversaries.

18143.text: /Yahweh, you will ordain peace for us, for you have also done all our work for us.

18144.text: /Yahweh our God, other lords besides you have had dominion over us, but by you only will we make mention of your name.

18145.text: /The dead shall not live. The departed spirits shall not rise. Therefore you have visited and destroyed them, and caused all memory of them to perish.

18146.text: /You have increased the nation, O Yahweh. You have increased the nation! You are glorified! You have enlarged all the borders of the land.

18147.text: /Yahweh, in trouble they have visited you. They poured out a prayer when your chastening was on them.

18148.text: /Like as a woman with child, who draws near the time of her delivery, is in pain and cries out in her pangs; so we have been before you, Yahweh.

18149.text: /We have been with child. We have been in pain. We gave birth, it seems, only to wind. We have not worked any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.

18150.text: /Your dead shall live. My dead bodies shall arise. Awake and sing, you who dwell in the dust; for your dew is like the dew of herbs, and the earth will cast out the departed spirits.

18151.text: ¶Come, my people, enter into your rooms, and shut your doors behind you. Hide yourself for a little moment, until the indignation is past.

18152.text: For, behold, Yahweh comes out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity. The earth also will disclose her blood, and will no longer cover her slain.

18153.text: ¶In that day, Yahweh with his hard and great and strong sword will punish leviathan, the fleeing serpent, and leviathan the twisted serpent; and he will kill the dragon that is in the sea.

18154.text: In that day, sing to her, “A pleasant vineyard!

18155.text: I, Yahweh, am its keeper. I will water it every moment. Lest anyone damage it, I will keep it night and day.

18156.text: Wrath is not in me, but if I should find briers and thorns, I would do battle! I would march on them and I would burn them together.

18157.text: Or else let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me. Let him make peace with me.”

18158.text: ¶In days to come, Jacob will take root. Israel will blossom and bud. They will fill the surface of the world with fruit.

18159.text: Has he struck them as he struck those who struck them? Or are they killed like those who killed them were killed?

18160.text: In measure, when you send them away, you contend with them. He has removed them with his rough blast in the day of the east wind.

18161.text: Therefore by this the iniquity of Jacob will be forgiven, and this is all the fruit of taking away his sin: that he makes all the stones of the altar as chalk stones that are beaten in pieces, so that the Asherah poles and the incense altars shall rise no more.

18162.text: For the fortified city is solitary, a habitation deserted and forsaken, like the wilderness. The calf will feed there, and there he will lie down, and consume its branches.

18163.text: When its boughs are withered, they will be broken off. The women will come and set them on fire, for they are a people of no understanding. Therefore he who made them will not have compassion on them, and he who formed them will show them no favor.

18164.text: It will happen in that day, that Yahweh will thresh from the flowing stream of the Euphrates to the brook of Egypt; and you will be gathered one by one, children of Israel.

18165.text: It will happen in that day that a great trumpet will be blown; and those who were ready to perish in the land of Assyria, and those who were outcasts in the land of Egypt, shall come; and they will worship Yahweh in the holy mountain at Jerusalem.

18166.text: ¶Woe to the crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim, and to the fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fertile valley of those who are overcome with wine!

18167.text: Behold, the Lord has a mighty and strong one. Like a storm of hail, a destroying storm, and like a storm of mighty waters overflowing, he will cast them down to the earth with his hand.

18168.text: The crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim will be trodden under foot.

18169.text: The fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fertile valley, shall be like the first‑ripe fig before the summer; which someone picks and eats as soon as he sees it.

18170.text: In that day, Yahweh of Armies will become a crown of glory, and a diadem of beauty, to the residue of his people;

18171.text: and a spirit of justice to him who sits in judgment, and strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate.

18172.text: They also reel with wine, and stagger with strong drink. The priest and the prophet reel with strong drink. They are swallowed up by wine. They stagger with strong drink. They err in vision. They stumble in judgment.

18173.text: For all tables are completely full of filthy vomit and filthiness.

18174.text: Whom will he teach knowledge? To whom will he explain the message? Those who are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts?

18175.text: For it is precept on precept, precept on precept; line on line, line on line; here a little, there a little.

18176.text: But he will speak to this nation with stammering lips and in another language;

18177.text: to whom he said, “This is the resting place. Give rest to weary”; and “This is the refreshing”; yet they would not hear.

18178.text: Therefore Yahweh’s word will be to them precept on precept, precept on precept; line on line, line on line; here a little, there a little; that they may go, fall backward, be broken, be snared, and be taken.

18179.text: Therefore hear Yahweh’s word, you scoffers, that rule this people in Jerusalem:

18180.text: “Because you have said, ‘We have made a covenant with death, and with Sheol  are we in agreement. When the overflowing scourge passes through, it won’t come to us; for we have made lies our refuge, and we have hidden ourselves under falsehood.’”

18181.text: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh, “Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious cornerstone of a sure foundation. He who believes shall not act hastily.

18182.text: I will make justice the measuring line, and righteousness the plumb line. The hail will sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters will overflow the hiding place.

18183.text: Your covenant with death shall be annulled, and your agreement with Sheol  shall not stand. When the overflowing scourge passes through, then you will be trampled down by it.
