18184.text: As often as it passes through, it will seize you; for morning by morning it will pass through, by day and by night; and it will be nothing but terror to understand the message.”

18185.text: For the bed is too short to stretch out on, and the blanket is too narrow to wrap oneself in.

18186.text: For Yahweh will rise up as on Mount Perazim. He will be angry as in the valley of Gibeon; that he may do his work, his unusual work, and bring to pass his act, his extraordinary act.

18187.text: Now therefore don’t be scoffers, lest your bonds be made strong; for I have heard a decree of destruction from the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, on the whole earth.

18188.text: ¶Give ear, and hear my voice! Listen, and hear my speech!

18189.text: Does he who plows to sow plow continually? Does he keep turning the soil and breaking the clods?

18190.text: When he has leveled its surface, doesn’t he plant the dill, and scatter the cumin seed, and put in the wheat in rows, the barley in the appointed place, and the spelt in its place?

18191.text: For his God instructs him in right judgment, and teaches him.

18192.text: For the dill are not threshed with a sharp instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned over the cumin; but the dill is beaten out with a stick, and the cumin with a rod.

18193.text: Bread flour must be ground; so he will not always be threshing it. Although he drives the wheel of his threshing cart over it, his horses don’t grind it.

18194.text: This also comes out from Yahweh of Armies, who is wonderful in counsel, and excellent in wisdom.

18195.text: ¶Woe to Ariel! Ariel, the city where David encamped! Add year to year; let the feasts come around;

18196.text: then I will distress Ariel, and there will be mourning and lamentation. She shall be to me as an altar hearth.

18197.text: I will encamp against you all around you, and will lay siege against you with posted troops. I will raise siege works against you.

18198.text: You will be brought down, and will speak out of the ground. Your speech will mumble out of the dust. Your voice will be as of one who has a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and your speech will whisper out of the dust.

18199.text: But the multitude of your foes will be like fine dust, and the multitude of the ruthless ones like chaff that blows away. Yes, it will be in an instant, suddenly.

18200.text: She will be visited by Yahweh of Armies with thunder, with earthquake, with great noise, with whirlwind and storm, and with the flame of a devouring fire.

18201.text: The multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, even all who fight against her and her stronghold, and who distress her, will be like a dream, a vision of the night.

18202.text: It will be like when a hungry man dreams, and behold, he eats; but he awakes, and his hunger isn’t satisfied; or like when a thirsty man dreams, and behold, he drinks; but he awakes, and behold, he is faint, and he is still thirsty. The multitude of all the nations that fight against Mount Zion will be like that.

18203.text: Pause and wonder! Blind yourselves and be blind! They are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.

18204.text: For Yahweh has poured out on you a spirit of deep sleep, and has closed your eyes, the prophets; and he has covered your heads, the seers.

18205.text: All vision has become to you like the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one who is educated, saying, “Read this, please”; and he says, “I can’t, for it is sealed:”

18206.text: and the book is delivered to one who is not educated, saying, “Read this, please”; and he says, “I can’t read.”

18207.text: The Lord said, “Because this people draws near with their mouth and with their lips to honor me, but they have removed their heart far from me, and their fear of me is a commandment of men which has been taught;

18208.text: therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvelous work among this people, even a marvelous work and a wonder; and the wisdom of their wise men will perish, and the understanding of their prudent men will be hidden.”

18209.text: ¶Woe to those who deeply hide their counsel from Yahweh, and whose deeds are in the dark, and who say, “Who sees us?” and “Who knows us?”

18210.text: You turn things upside down! Should the potter be thought to be like clay; that the thing made should say about him who made it, “He didn’t make me”; or the thing formed say of him who formed it, “He has no understanding?”

18211.text: ¶Isn’t it yet a very little while, and Lebanon will be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field will be regarded as a forest?

18212.text: In that day, the deaf will hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind will see out of obscurity and out of darkness.

18213.text: The humble also will increase their joy in Yahweh, and the poor among men will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.

18214.text: For the ruthless is brought to nothing, and the scoffer ceases, and all those who are alert to do evil are cut off—

18215.text: who cause a person to be indicted by a word, and lay a snare for the arbiter in the gate, and who deprive the innocent of justice with false testimony.

18216.text: Therefore Yahweh, who redeemed Abraham, says concerning the house of Jacob: “Jacob shall no longer be ashamed, neither shall his face grow pale.

18217.text: But when he sees his children, the work of my hands, in the middle of him, they will sanctify my name. Yes, they will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and will stand in awe of the God of Israel.

18218.text: They also who err in spirit will come to understanding, and those who grumble will receive instruction.”

18219.text: ¶“Woe to the rebellious children”, says Yahweh, “who take counsel, but not from me; and who make an alliance, but not with my Spirit, that they may add sin to sin,

18220.text: who set out to go down into Egypt, and have not asked my advice; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to take refuge in the shadow of Egypt!

18221.text: Therefore the strength of Pharaoh will be your shame, and the refuge in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.

18222.text: For their princes are at Zoan, and their ambassadors have come to Hanes.

18223.text: They shall all be ashamed because of a people that can’t profit them, that are not a help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.”

18224.text: ¶The burden of the animals of the South. Through the land of trouble and anguish, of the lioness and the lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent, they carry their riches on the shoulders of young donkeys, and their treasures on the humps of camels, to an unprofitable people.

18225.text: For Egypt helps in vain, and to no purpose; therefore have I called her Rahab who sits still.

18226.text: Now go, write it before them on a tablet, and inscribe it in a book, that it may be for the time to come forever and ever.

18227.text: For it is a rebellious people, lying children, children who will not hear Yahweh’s law;

18228.text: who tell the seers, “Don’t see!” and to the prophets, “Don’t prophesy to us right things. Tell us pleasant things. Prophesy deceits.

18229.text: Get out of the way. Turn aside from the path. Cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.”

18230.text: Therefore thus says the Holy One of Israel, “Because you despise this word, and trust in oppression and perverseness, and rely on it;

18231.text: therefore this iniquity shall be to you like a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking comes suddenly in an instant.

18232.text: He will break it as a potter’s vessel is broken, breaking it in pieces without sparing, so that there won’t be found among the broken piece a piece good enough to take fire from the hearth, or to dip up water out of the cistern.”

18233.text: For thus said the Lord Yahweh, the Holy One of Israel, “You will be saved in returning and rest. Your strength will be in quietness and in confidence.” You refused,

18234.text: but you said, “No, for we will flee on horses”; therefore you will flee; and, “We will ride on the swift”; therefore those who pursue you will be swift.

18235.text: One thousand will flee at the threat of one. At the threat of five, you will flee until you are left like a beacon on the top of a mountain, and like a banner on a hill.

18236.text: Therefore Yahweh will wait, that he may be gracious to you; and therefore he will be exalted, that he may have mercy on you, for Yahweh is a God of justice. Blessed are all those who wait for him.

18237.text: For the people will dwell in Zion at Jerusalem. You will weep no more. He will surely be gracious to you at the voice of your cry. When he hears you, he will answer you.

18238.text: Though the Lord may give you the bread of adversity and the water of affliction, yet your teachers won’t be hidden any more, but your eyes will see your teachers;

18239.text: and when you turn to the right hand, and when you turn to the left, your ears will hear a voice behind you, saying, “This is the way. Walk in it.”

18240.text: You shall defile the overlaying of your engraved images of silver, and the plating of your molten images of gold. You shall cast them away as an unclean thing. You shall tell it, “Go away!”

18241.text: He will give the rain for your seed, with which you will sow the ground; and bread of the increase of the ground will be rich and plentiful. In that day, your livestock will feed in large pastures.

18242.text: The oxen likewise and the young donkeys that till the ground will eat savory feed, which has been winnowed with the shovel and with the fork.

18243.text: There shall be brooks and streams of water on every lofty mountain and on every high hill in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.

18244.text: Moreover the light of the moon will be like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be seven times brighter, like the light of seven days, in the day that Yahweh binds up the fracture of his people, and heals the wound they were struck with.

18245.text: ¶Behold, Yahweh’s name comes from far away, burning with his anger, and in thick rising smoke. His lips are full of indignation, and his tongue is as a devouring fire.

18246.text: His breath is as an overflowing stream that reaches even to the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of destruction; and a bridle that leads to ruin will be in the jaws of the peoples.

18247.text: You will have a song, as in the night when a holy feast is kept; and gladness of heart, as when one goes with a flute to come to Yahweh’s mountain, to Israel’s Rock.

18248.text: Yahweh will cause his glorious voice to be heard, and will show the descent of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and the flame of a devouring fire, with a blast, storm, and hailstones.

18249.text: For through Yahweh’s voice the Assyrian will be dismayed. He will strike him with his rod.

18250.text: Every stroke of the rod of punishment, which Yahweh will lay on him, will be with the sound of tambourines and harps. He will fight with them in battles, brandishing weapons.

18251.text: For his burning place has long been ready. Yes, for the king it is prepared. He has made its pyre deep and large with fire and much wood. Yahweh’s breath, like a stream of sulfur, kindles it.

18252.text: ¶Woe to those who go down to Egypt for help,/_and rely on horses,/_and trust in chariots because they are many,/_and in horsemen because they are very strong,/_but they don’t look to the Holy One of Israel,/_and they don’t seek Yahweh!

18253.text: /Yet he also is wise, and will bring disaster,/_and will not call back his words, but will arise against the house of the evildoers,/_and against the help of those who work iniquity.

18254.text: /Now the Egyptians are men, and not God;/_and their horses flesh, and not spirit./When Yahweh stretches out his hand, both he who helps shall stumble,/_and he who is helped shall fall,/_and they all shall be consumed together.

18255.text: /For Yahweh says to me,/“As the lion and the young lion growling over his prey,/_if a multitude of shepherds is called together against him,/_will not be dismayed at their voice,/_nor abase himself for their noise,/_so Yahweh of Armies will come down to fight on Mount Zion and on its heights.

18256.text: /As birds hovering, so Yahweh of Armies will protect Jerusalem./_He will protect and deliver it./_He will pass over and preserve it.”

18257.text: /Return to him from whom you have deeply revolted, children of Israel.

18258.text: /For in that day everyone shall cast away his idols of silver and his idols of gold—sin which your own hands have made for you.

18259.text: ¶“The Assyrian will fall by the sword, not of man;¶▼and the sword, not of mankind, shall devour him./He will flee from the sword,/_and his young men will become subject to forced labor.

18260.text: /His rock will pass away by reason of terror,/_and his princes will be afraid of the banner,”/says Yahweh, whose fire is in Zion,/_and his furnace in Jerusalem.

18261.text: ¶Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness,/_and princes shall rule in justice.

18262.text: /A man shall be as a hiding place from the wind,/_and a covert from the storm,/_as streams of water in a dry place,/_as the shade of a large rock in a weary land.

18263.text: /The eyes of those who see will not be dim,/_and the ears of those who hear will listen.

18264.text: /The heart of the rash will understand knowledge,/_and the tongue of the stammerers will be ready to speak plainly.

18265.text: /The fool will no longer be called noble,/_nor the scoundrel be highly respected.

18266.text: /For the fool will speak folly,/_and his heart will work iniquity,/_to practice profanity,/_and to utter error against Yahweh,/_To make empty the soul of the hungry,/_and to cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.

18267.text: /The ways of the scoundrel are evil./_He devises wicked devices to destroy the humble with lying words,/_even when the needy speaks right.

18268.text: /But the noble devises noble things;/_and he will continue in noble things.

18269.text: /Rise up, you women who are at ease! Hear my voice!/_You careless daughters, give ear to my speech!

18270.text: /For days beyond a year you will be troubled, you careless women;/_for the vintage shall fail./_The harvest won’t come.

18271.text: /Tremble, you women who are at ease!/_Be troubled, you careless ones!/_Strip yourselves, make yourselves naked,/_and put sackcloth on your waist.

18272.text: /Beat your breasts for the pleasant fields,/_for the fruitful vine.

18273.text: /Thorns and briers will come up on my people’s land;/_yes, on all the houses of joy in the joyous city.

18274.text: /For the palace will be forsaken./_The populous city will be deserted./_The hill and the watchtower will be for dens forever,/_a delight for wild donkeys,/_a pasture of flocks;

18275.text: /Until the Spirit is poured on us from on high,/_and the wilderness becomes a fruitful field,/_and the fruitful field is considered a forest.

18276.text: /Then justice will dwell in the wilderness;/_and righteousness will remain in the fruitful field.

18277.text: /The work of righteousness will be peace;/_and the effect of righteousness, quietness and confidence forever.

18278.text: /My people will live in a peaceful habitation,/_in safe dwellings,/_and in quiet resting places.

18279.text: /Though hail flattens the forest,/_and the city is leveled completely.

18280.text: /Blessed are you who sow beside all waters,/_who send out the feet of the ox and the donkey.

18281.text: ¶Woe to you who destroy, but you weren’t destroyed;/_and who betray, but nobody betrayed you!/When you have finished destroying, you will be destroyed;/_and when you have finished betrayal, you will be betrayed.

18282.text: ¶Yahweh, be gracious to us. We have waited for you./_Be our strength every morning,/_our salvation also in the time of trouble.

18283.text: /At the noise of the thunder, the peoples have fled./_When you lift yourself up, the nations are scattered.

18284.text: /Your plunder will be gathered as the caterpillar gathers./_Men will leap on it as locusts leap.

18285.text: /Yahweh is exalted, for he dwells on high./_He has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.

18286.text: /There will be stability in your times, abundance of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge./_The fear of Yahweh is your treasure.

18287.text: /Behold, their valiant ones cry outside;/_the ambassadors of peace weep bitterly.

18288.text: /The highways are desolate./_The traveling man ceases./_The covenant is broken./_He has despised the cities./_He doesn’t respect man.

18289.text: /The land mourns and languishes./_Lebanon is confounded and withers away./_Sharon is like a desert, and Bashan and Carmel are stripped bare.

18290.text: /“Now I will arise,” says Yahweh;/_“Now I will lift myself up./_Now I will be exalted.

18291.text: /You will conceive chaff./_You will give birth to stubble./_Your breath is a fire that will devour you.

18292.text: /The peoples will be like the burning of lime,/_like thorns that are cut down and burned in the fire.

18293.text: /Hear, you who are far off, what I have done;/_and, you who are near, acknowledge my might.”

18294.text: /The sinners in Zion are afraid./_Trembling has seized the godless ones./Who among us can live with the devouring fire?/_Who among us can live with everlasting burning?

18295.text: /He who walks righteously,/_and speaks blamelessly;/_He who despises the gain of oppressions,/_who gestures with his hands, refusing to take a bribe,/_who stops his ears from hearing of blood,/_and shuts his eyes from looking at evil—

18296.text: /he will dwell on high./_His place of defense will be the fortress of rocks./_His bread will be supplied./_His waters will be sure.

18297.text: /Your eyes will see the king in his beauty./_They will see a distant land.

18298.text: /Your heart will meditate on the terror./_Where is he who counted?/_Where is he who weighed?/_Where is he who counted the towers?

18299.text: /You will no longer see the fierce people,/_a people of a deep speech that you can’t comprehend,/_with a strange language that you can’t understand.

18300.text: /Look at Zion, the city of our appointed festivals./_Your eyes will see Jerusalem, a quiet habitation,/_a tent that won’t be removed./Its stakes will never be plucked up,/_nor will any of its cords be broken.

18301.text: /But there Yahweh will be with us in majesty,/_a place of wide rivers and streams,/_in which no galley with oars will go,/_neither will any gallant ship pass by there.

18302.text: /For Yahweh is our judge./_Yahweh is our lawgiver./_Yahweh is our king./_He will save us.

18303.text: ¶Your rigging is untied./_They couldn’t strengthen the foot of their mast./_They couldn’t spread the sail./Then the prey of a great plunder was divided./_The lame took the prey.

18304.text: ¶The inhabitant won’t say, “I am sick.”/_The people who dwell therein will be forgiven their iniquity.

18305.text: ¶Come near, you nations, to hear!/_Listen, you peoples./_Let the earth and all it contains hear;/_the world, and everything that comes from it.

18306.text: /For Yahweh is enraged against all the nations,/_and angry with all their armies./He has utterly destroyed them./_He has given them over for slaughter.

18307.text: /Their slain will also be cast out,/_and the stench of their dead bodies will come up;/_and the mountains will melt in their blood.

18308.text: /All of the army of the sky will be dissolved./_The sky will be rolled up like a scroll,/_and all its armies will fade away,/_as a leaf fades from off a vine or a fig tree.

18309.text: /For my sword has drunk its fill in the sky./_Behold, it will come down on Edom,/_and on the people of my curse, for judgment.

18310.text: /Yahweh’s sword is filled with blood./_It is covered with fat, with the blood of lambs and goats,/_with the fat of the kidneys of rams;/_for Yahweh has a sacrifice in Bozrah,/_And a great slaughter in the land of Edom.

18311.text: /The wild oxen will come down with them,/_and the young bulls with the mighty bulls;/_and their land will be drunken with blood,/_and their dust made greasy with fat.

18312.text: /For Yahweh has a day of vengeance,/_a year of recompense for the cause of Zion.

18313.text: /Its streams will be turned into pitch,/_its dust into sulfur,/_And its land will become burning pitch.

18314.text: /It won’t be quenched night nor day./_Its smoke will go up forever./_From generation to generation, it will lie waste./_No one will pass through it forever and ever.

18315.text: /But the pelican and the porcupine will possess it./_The owl and the raven will dwell in it./He will stretch the line of confusion over it,/_and the plumb line of emptiness.

18316.text: /They shall call its nobles to the kingdom, but none shall be there;/_and all its princes shall be nothing.

18317.text: /Thorns will come up in its palaces,/_nettles and thistles in its fortresses;/_and it will be a habitation of jackals,/_a court for ostriches.

18318.text: /The wild animals of the desert will meet with the wolves,/_and the wild goat will cry to his fellow./Yes, the night creature shall settle there,/_and shall find herself a place of rest.

18319.text: /The arrow snake will make her nest there,/_and lay, hatch, and gather under her shade./_Yes, the kites will be gathered there, every one with her mate.

18320.text: /Search in the book of Yahweh, and read:/_not one of these will be missing./_none will lack her mate./_For my mouth has commanded,/_and his Spirit has gathered them.

18321.text: /He has cast the lot for them,/_and his hand has divided it to them with a measuring line./_They shall possess it forever./_From generation to generation they will dwell in it.

18322.text: ¶The wilderness and the dry land will be glad./_The desert will rejoice and blossom like a rose.

18323.text: /It will blossom abundantly,/_and rejoice even with joy and singing./_Lebanon’s glory will be given to it,/_the excellence of Carmel and Sharon./_They will see Yahweh’s glory,/_the excellence of our God.

18324.text: /Strengthen the weak hands,/_and make firm the feeble knees.

18325.text: /Tell those who have a fearful heart, “Be strong./_Don’t be afraid./_Behold, your God will come with vengeance, God’s retribution./_He will come and save you.

18326.text: /Then the eyes of the blind will be opened,/_and the ears of the deaf will be unstopped.

18327.text: /Then the lame man will leap like a deer,/_and the tongue of the mute will sing;/_for waters will break out in the wilderness,/_and streams in the desert.

18328.text: /The burning sand will become a pool,/_and the thirsty ground springs of water./_Grass with reeds and rushes will be in the habitation of jackals, where they lay.

18329.text: /A highway will be there, a road,/_and it will be called The Holy Way./The unclean shall not pass over it,/_but it will be for those who walk in the Way./_Wicked fools will not go there.

18330.text: /No lion will be there,/_nor will any ravenous animal go up on it./_They will not be found there;/_but the redeemed will walk there.

18331.text: /The Yahweh’s ransomed ones will return,/_and come with singing to Zion;/_and everlasting joy will be on their heads./They will obtain gladness and joy,/_and sorrow and sighing will flee away.”

18332.text: ¶Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked all of the fortified cities of Judah, and captured them.

18333.text: The king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem to king Hezekiah with a large army. He stood by the aqueduct from the upper pool in the fuller’s field highway.

18334.text: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder came out to him.

18335.text: Rabshakeh said to them, “Now tell Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria, “What confidence is this in which you trust?

18336.text: I say that your counsel and strength for the war are only vain words. Now in whom do you trust, that you have rebelled against me?

18337.text: Behold, you trust in the staff of this bruised reed, even in Egypt, which if a man leans on it, it will go into his hand and pierce it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust in him.

18338.text: But if you tell me, ‘We trust in Yahweh our God,’ isn’t that he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away, and has said to Judah and to Jerusalem, ‘You shall worship before this altar?’”

18339.text: Now therefore, please make a pledge to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able on your part to set riders on them.

18340.text: How then can you turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master’s servants, and put your trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?

18341.text: Have I come up now without Yahweh against this land to destroy it? Yahweh said to me, “Go up against this land, and destroy it.”’”

18342.text: ¶Then Eliakim, Shebna and Joah said to Rabshakeh, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it; and don’t speak to us in the Jews’ language in the hearing of the people who are on the wall.”

18343.text: ¶But Rabshakeh said, “Has my master sent me only to your master and to you, to speak these words, and not to the men who sit on the wall, who will eat their own dung and drink their own urine with you?”

18344.text: Then Rabshakeh stood, and called out with a loud voice in the Jews’ language, and said, “Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!

18345.text: Thus says the king, ‘Don’t let Hezekiah deceive you; for he will not be able to deliver you.

18346.text: Don’t let Hezekiah make you trust in Yahweh, saying, “Yahweh will surely deliver us. This city won’t be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.”’

18347.text: Don’t listen to Hezekiah, for thus says the king of Assyria, ‘Make your peace with me, and come out to me; and each of you eat from his vine, and each one from his fig tree, and each one of you drink the waters of his own cistern;

18348.text: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.

18349.text: Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, “Yahweh will deliver us.” Have any of the gods of the nations delivered their lands from the hand of the king of Assyria?

18350.text: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Have they delivered Samaria from my hand?

18351.text: Who are they among all the gods of these countries that have delivered their country out of my hand, that Yahweh should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?’”

18352.text: ¶But they remained silent, and said nothing in reply, for the king’s commandment was, “Don’t answer him.”

18353.text: ¶Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.

18354.text: ¶When king Hezekiah heard it, he tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into Yahweh’s house.

18355.text: He sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.

18356.text: They said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah, ‘Today is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and of rejection; for the children have come to the birth, and there is no strength to give birth.

18357.text: It may be Yahweh your God will hear the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master has sent to defy the living God, and will rebuke the words which Yahweh your God has heard. Therefore lift up your prayer for the remnant that is left.’”

18358.text: So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

18359.text: ¶Isaiah said to them, “Tell your master, ‘Yahweh says, “Don’t be afraid of the words that you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.

18360.text: Behold, I will put a spirit in him and he will hear news, and will return to his own land. I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.”’”

18361.text: ¶So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah, for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.

18362.text: He heard news concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, “He has come out to fight against you.” When he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,

18363.text: “Thus you shall speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, ‘Don’t let your God in whom you trust deceive you, saying, “Jerusalem won’t be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.”

18364.text: Behold, you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, by destroying them utterly. Shall you be delivered?

18365.text: Have the gods of the nations delivered them, which my fathers have destroyed, Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the children of Eden who were in Telassar?

18366.text: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivvah?’”

18367.text: ¶Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers and read it. Then Hezekiah went up to Yahweh’s house, and spread it before Yahweh.

18369.text: “Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, who is enthroned among the cherubim, you are the God, even you alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.

18370.text: Turn your ear, Yahweh, and hear. Open your eyes, Yahweh, and behold. Hear all of the words of Sennacherib, who has sent to defy the living God.

18371.text: Truly, Yahweh, the kings of Assyria have destroyed all the countries and their land,

18372.text: and have cast their gods into the fire; for they were no gods, but the work of men’s hands, wood and stone; therefore they have destroyed them.

18373.text: Now therefore, Yahweh our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you are Yahweh, even you only.”

18374.text: ¶Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, “Yahweh, the God of Israel says, ‘Because you have prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria,

18375.text: this is the word which Yahweh has spoken concerning him. The virgin daughter of Zion has despised you and ridiculed you. The daughter of Jerusalem has shaken her head at you.

18376.text: Whom have you defied and blasphemed? Against whom have you exalted your voice and lifted up your eyes on high? Against the Holy One of Israel.

18377.text: By your servants, have you defied the Lord, and have said, “With the multitude of my chariots I have come up to the height of the mountains, to the innermost parts of Lebanon. I will cut down its tall cedars and its choice cypress trees. I will enter into its farthest height, the forest of its fruitful field.

18378.text: I have dug and drunk water, and with the sole of my feet I will dry up all the rivers of Egypt.”

18379.text: Have you not heard how I have done it long ago, and formed it in ancient times? Now I have brought it to pass, that it should be yours to destroy fortified cities, turning them into ruinous heaps.

18380.text: Therefore their inhabitants had little power. They were dismayed and confounded. They were like the grass of the field, and like the green herb, like the grass on the housetops, and like a field before its crop has grown.

18381.text: But I know your sitting down, your going out, your coming in, and your raging against me.

18382.text: Because of your raging against me, and because your arrogance has come up into my ears, therefore will I put my hook in your nose and my bridle in your lips, and I will turn you back by the way by which you came.

18383.text: This shall be the sign to you. You will eat this year that which grows of itself, and in the second year that which springs from the same; and in the third year sow and reap and plant vineyards, and eat their fruit.

18384.text: The remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah will again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.

18385.text: For out of Jerusalem a remnant will go out, and survivors will escape from Mount Zion. The zeal of Yahweh of Armies will perform this.’

18386.text: Therefore Yahweh says concerning the king of Assyria, ‘He will not come to this city, nor shoot an arrow there, neither will he come before it with shield, nor cast up a mound against it.

18387.text: By the way that he came, by the same he shall return, and he shall not come to this city,’ says Yahweh.

18388.text: ‘For I will defend this city to save it, for my own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.’”

18389.text: ¶Yahweh’s angel went out and struck one hundred and eighty‑five thousand men in the camp of the Assyrians. When men arose early in the morning, behold, these were all dead bodies.

18390.text: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, went away, returned to Nineveh, and stayed there.

18391.text: As he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons struck him with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Ararat. Esar Haddon his son reigned in his place.

18392.text: ¶In those days was Hezekiah sick and near death. Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, came to him, and said to him, “Yahweh says, ‘Set your house in order, for you will die, and not live.’”

18393.text: ¶Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to Yahweh,

18394.text: and said, “Remember now, Yahweh, I beg you, how I have walked before you in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in your sight.” Hezekiah wept bitterly.

18395.text: ¶Then Yahweh’s word came to Isaiah, saying,

18396.text: “Go, and tell Hezekiah, ‘Yahweh says, the God of David your father, “I have heard your prayer. I have seen your tears. Behold, I will add fifteen years to your life.

18397.text: I will deliver you and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria, and I will defend this city.

18398.text: This shall be the sign to you from Yahweh, that Yahweh will do this thing that he has spoken.

18399.text: Behold, I will cause the shadow on the sundial, which has gone down on the sundial of Ahaz with the sun, to return backward ten steps. So the sun returned ten steps on the sundial on which it had gone down.”’”

18400.text: ¶The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and had recovered of his sickness.

18401.text: ¶I said, “In the middle of my life I go into the gates of Sheol.¶▼I am deprived of the residue of my years.”

18402.text: /I said, “I won’t see Yah,/_Yah in the land of the living./_I will see man no more with the inhabitants of the world.

18403.text: /My dwelling is removed,/_and is carried away from me like a shepherd’s tent./I have rolled up, like a weaver, my life./_He will cut me off from the loom./_From day even to night you will make an end of me.

18404.text: /I waited patiently until morning./_He breaks all my bones like a lion./_From day even to night you will make an end of me.

18405.text: /I chattered like a swallow or a crane./_I moaned like a dove./_My eyes weaken looking upward./_Lord, I am oppressed./_Be my security.”

18406.text: /What will I say?/_He has both spoken to me, and himself has done it./_I will walk carefully all my years because of the anguish of my soul.

18407.text: /Lord, men live by these things;/_and my spirit finds life in all of them:/_you restore me, and cause me to live.

18408.text: /Behold, for peace I had great anguish,/_but you have in love for my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption;/_for you have cast all my sins behind your back.

18409.text: /For Sheol can’t praise you./_Death can’t celebrate you./Those who go down into the pit can’t hope for your truth.

18410.text: /The living, the living, he shall praise you, as I do today./_The father shall make known your truth to the children.

18411.text: /Yahweh will save me./_Therefore we will sing my songs with stringed instruments all the days of our life in Yahweh’s house.

18412.text: ¶Now Isaiah had said, “Let them take a cake of figs, and lay it for a poultice on the boil, and he shall recover.”

18413.text: Hezekiah also had said, “What is the sign that I will go up to Yahweh’s house?”

18414.text: ¶At that time, Merodach Baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah; for he heard that he had been sick, and had recovered.

18415.text: Hezekiah was pleased with them, and showed them the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, the spices, and the precious oil, and all the house of his armor, and all that was found in his treasures. There was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah didn’t show them.

18416.text: Then Isaiah the prophet came to king Hezekiah, and asked him, “What did these men say? Where did they come from to you?”¶Hezekiah said, “They have come from a country far from me, even from Babylon.”

18417.text: ¶Then he asked, “What have they seen in your house?”¶Hezekiah answered, “They have seen all that is in my house. There is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them.”

18418.text: ¶Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of Yahweh of Armies:

18419.text: ‘Behold, the days are coming when all that is in your house, and that which your fathers have stored up until today, will be carried to Babylon. Nothing will be left,’ says Yahweh.

18420.text: ‘They will take away your sons who will issue from you, whom you shall father, and they will be eunuchs in the king of Babylon’s palace.’”

18421.text: ¶Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “Yahweh’s word which you have spoken is good.” He said moreover, “For there will be peace and truth in my days.”

18422.text: ¶“Comfort, comfort my people,” says your God.

18423.text: “Speak comfortably to Jerusalem; and call out to her that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned, that she has received of Yahweh’s hand double for all her sins.”

18424.text: ¶The voice of one who calls out,¶▼“Prepare the way of Yahweh in the wilderness!/_Make a level highway in the desert for our God.

18425.text: /Every valley shall be exalted,/_and every mountain and hill shall be made low./_The uneven shall be made level,/_and the rough places a plain.

18426.text: /Yahweh’s glory shall be revealed,/_and all flesh shall see it together;/_for the mouth of Yahweh has spoken it.”

18427.text: /_The voice of one saying, “Cry!”/_One said, “What shall I cry?”/“All flesh is like grass,/_and all its glory is like the flower of the field.

18428.text: /The grass withers,/_the flower fades,/_because Yahweh’s breath blows on it./_Surely the people are like grass.

18429.text: /The grass withers,/_the flower fades;/_but the word of our God stands forever.”

18430.text: ¶You who tell good news to Zion, go up on a high mountain./_You who tell good news to Jerusalem, lift up your voice with strength./_Lift it up. Don’t be afraid./_Say to the cities of Judah, “Behold, your God!”

18431.text: /Behold, the Lord Yahweh will come as a mighty one,/_and his arm will rule for him./_Behold, his reward is with him,/_and his recompense before him.

18432.text: /He will feed his flock like a shepherd./_He will gather the lambs in his arm,/_and carry them in his bosom./_He will gently lead those who have their young.

18433.text: ¶Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand,/_and marked off the sky with his span,/_and calculated the dust of the earth in a measuring basket,/_and weighed the mountains in scales,/_and the hills in a balance?

18434.text: /Who has directed Yahweh’s Spirit,/_or has taught him as his counselor?

18435.text: /Who did he take counsel with,/_and who instructed him,/_and taught him in the path of justice,/_and taught him knowledge,/_and showed him the way of understanding?

18436.text: /Behold, the nations are like a drop in a bucket,/_and are regarded as a speck of dust on a balance./_Behold, he lifts up the islands like a very little thing.

18437.text: /Lebanon is not sufficient to burn,/_nor its animals sufficient for a burnt offering.

18438.text: /All the nations are like nothing before him./_They are regarded by him as less than nothing, and vanity.

18439.text: /To whom then will you liken God?/_Or what likeness will you compare to him?

18440.text: /A workman has cast an image,/_and the goldsmith overlays it with gold,/_and casts silver chains for it.

18441.text: /He who is too impoverished for such an offering chooses a tree that will not rot./_He seeks a skillful workman to set up an engraved image for him that will not be moved.

18442.text: ¶Haven’t you known?/_Haven’t you heard, yet?/_Haven’t you been told from the beginning?/_Haven’t you understood from the foundations of the earth?

18443.text: /It is he who sits above the circle of the earth,/_and its inhabitants are like grasshoppers;/_who stretches out the heavens like a curtain,/_and spreads them out like a tent to dwell in;

18444.text: /_who brings princes to nothing;/_who makes the judges of the earth like meaningless.

18445.text: /They are planted scarcely./_They are sown scarcely./_Their stock has scarcely taken root in the ground./_He merely blows on them, and they wither,/_and the whirlwind takes them away as stubble.

18446.text: ¶“To whom then will you liken me?/_Who is my equal?” says the Holy One.

18447.text: /Lift up your eyes on high,/_and see who has created these,/_who brings out their army by number./_He calls them all by name./_by the greatness of his might,/_and because he is strong in power,/_Not one is lacking.

18448.text: /Why do you say, Jacob,/_and speak, Israel,/_“My way is hidden from Yahweh,/_and the justice due me is disregarded by my God?”

18449.text: /Haven’t you known?/_Haven’t you heard?/_The everlasting God, Yahweh,/_The Creator of the ends of the earth, doesn’t faint./_He isn’t weary./_His understanding is unsearchable.

18450.text: /He gives power to the weak./_He increases the strength of him who has no might.

18451.text: /Even the youths faint and get weary,/_and the young men utterly fall;

18452.text: /_But those who wait for Yahweh will renew their strength./_They will mount up with wings like eagles./_They will run, and not be weary./_They will walk, and not faint.

18453.text: ¶“Keep silent before me, islands,/_and let the peoples renew their strength./Let them come near,/_then let them speak./_Let’s meet together for judgment.

18454.text: /Who has raised up one from the east?/_Who called him to his foot in righteousness?/_He hands over nations to him,/_and makes him rule over kings./_He gives them like the dust to his sword,/_like the driven stubble to his bow.

18455.text: /He pursues them,/_and passes by safely,/_Even by a way that he had not gone with his feet.

18456.text: /Who has worked and done it,/_calling the generations from the beginning?/_I, Yahweh, the first, and with the last, I am he.”

18457.text: ¶The islands have seen, and fear./_The ends of the earth tremble./_They approach, and come.

18458.text: /Everyone helps his neighbor./_They say to their brothers, “Be strong!”

18459.text: /So the carpenter encourages the goldsmith./_He who smoothes with the hammer encourages him who strikes the anvil,/_saying of the soldering, “It is good”;/_and he fastens it with nails, that it might not totter.

18460.text: /“But you, Israel, my servant,/_Jacob whom I have chosen,/_the offspring of Abraham my friend,

18461.text: /_You whom I have taken hold of from the ends of the earth,/_and called from its corners,/_and said to you, ‘You are my servant, I have chosen you and not cast you away;’

18462.text: /Don’t you be afraid, for I am with you./_Don’t be dismayed, for I am your God./_I will strengthen you./_Yes, I will help you./_Yes, I will uphold you with the right hand of my righteousness.

18463.text: /Behold, all those who are incensed against you will be disappointed and confounded./_Those who strive with you will be like nothing, and shall perish.

18464.text: /You will seek them, and won’t find them,/_even those who contend with you./_Those who war against you will be as nothing,/_as a non‑existent thing.

18465.text: /For I, Yahweh your God, will hold your right hand,/_saying to you, ‘Don’t be afraid./_I will help you.’

18466.text: /Don’t be afraid, you worm Jacob,/_and you men of Israel./_I will help you,” says Yahweh,/_“and your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel.

18467.text: /Behold, I have made you into a new sharp threshing instrument with teeth./_You will thresh the mountains,/_and beat them small,/_and will make the hills like chaff.

18468.text: /You will winnow them,/_and the wind will carry them away,/_and the whirlwind will scatter them./You will rejoice in Yahweh./_You will glory in the Holy One of Israel.

18469.text: /The poor and needy seek water, and there is none./_Their tongue fails for thirst./I, Yahweh, will answer them./_I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.

18470.text: /I will open rivers on the bare heights,/_and springs in the middle of the valleys./_I will make the wilderness a pool of water,/_and the dry land springs of water.

18471.text: /I will put cedar, acacia, myrtle, and oil trees in the wilderness./_I will set cypress trees, pine, and box trees together in the desert;

18472.text: /_that they may see, know, consider, and understand together,/_that Yahweh’s hand has done this,/_and the Holy One of Israel has created it.

18473.text: /Produce your cause,” says Yahweh./_“Bring out your strong reasons,” says the King of Jacob.

18474.text: /“Let them announce, and declare to us what shall happen./_Declare the former things, what they are,/_that we may consider them, and know the latter end of them;/_or show us things to come.

18475.text: /Declare the things that are to come hereafter,/_that we may know that you are gods./Yes, do good, or do evil,/_that we may be dismayed,/_and see it together.

18476.text: /Behold, you are of nothing,/_and your work is of nothing./_He who chooses you is an abomination.

18477.text: ¶“I have raised up one from the north, and he has come;/_from the rising of the sun, one who calls on my name;/_and he shall come on rulers as on mortar,/_and as the potter treads clay.

18478.text: /Who has declared it from the beginning, that we may know?/_And before, that we may say, ‘He is right?’/Surely, there is no one who declares./_Surely, there is no one who shows./_Surely, there is no one who hears your words.

18479.text: /I am the first to say to Zion, ‘Behold, look at them;’/_and I will give one who brings good news to Jerusalem.

18480.text: /When I look, there is no man;/_even among them there is no counselor who, when I ask of them, can answer a word.

18481.text: /Behold, all of them, their deeds are vanity and nothing./_Their molten images are wind and confusion.

18482.text: ¶“Behold, my servant, whom I uphold;/_my chosen, in whom my soul delights—/_I have put my Spirit on him./_He will bring justice to the nations.

18483.text: /He will not shout,/_nor raise his voice,/_nor cause it to be heard in the street.

18484.text: /He won’t break a bruised reed./_He won’t quench a dimly burning wick./_He will faithfully bring justice.

18485.text: /He will not fail nor be discouraged,/_until he has set justice in the earth,/_and the islands will wait for his law.”

18486.text: /Thus says God Yahweh,/_he who created the heavens and stretched them out,/_he who spread out the earth and that which comes out of it,/_he who gives breath to its people and spirit to those who walk in it.

18487.text: /“I, Yahweh, have called you in righteousness,/_and will hold your hand,/_and will keep you,/_and make you a covenant for the people,/_as a light for the nations;

18488.text: /_to open the blind eyes,/_to bring the prisoners out of the dungeon,/_and those who sit in darkness out of the prison.

18489.text: ¶“I am Yahweh./_That is my name./_I will not give my glory to another,/_nor my praise to engraved images.

18490.text: /Behold, the former things have happened,/_and I declare new things./_I tell you about them before they come up.”

18491.text: ¶Sing to Yahweh a new song,/_and his praise from the end of the earth,/_you who go down to the sea,/_and all that is therein,/_the islands and their inhabitants.

18492.text: /Let the wilderness and its cities raise their voices,/_with the villages that Kedar inhabits./_Let the inhabitants of Sela sing./_Let them shout from the top of the mountains!

18493.text: /Let them give glory to Yahweh,/_and declare his praise in the islands.

18494.text: /Yahweh will go out like a mighty man./_He will stir up zeal like a man of war./_He will raise a war cry./_Yes, he will shout aloud./_He will triumph over his enemies.

18495.text: ¶“I have been silent a long time./_I have been quiet and restrained myself./_Now I will cry out like a travailing woman. I will both gasp and pant.

18496.text: /I will destroy mountains and hills,/_and dry up all their herbs./_I will make the rivers islands,/_and will dry up the pools.

18497.text: /I will bring the blind by a way that they don’t know./_I will lead them in paths that they don’t know./_I will make darkness light before them,/_and crooked places straight./_I will do these things,/_and I will not forsake them.

18498.text: ¶“Those who trust in engraved images,/_who tell molten images,/_‘You are our gods’/_will be turned back./_They will be utterly disappointed.

18499.text: ¶“Hear, you deaf,/_and look, you blind,/_that you may see.

18500.text: /Who is blind, but my servant?/_Or who is as deaf as my messenger whom I send?/_Who is as blind as he who is at peace,/_and as blind as Yahweh’s servant?

18501.text: /You see many things, but don’t observe./_His ears are open, but he doesn’t listen.

18502.text: /It pleased Yahweh, for his righteousness’ sake, to magnify the law,/_and make it honorable.

18503.text: /But this is a robbed and plundered people./_All of them are snared in holes,/_and they are hidden in prisons./They have become captives, and no one delivers;/_and a plunder, and no one says, ‘Restore them!’

18504.text: /Who is there among you who will give ear to this?/_Who will listen and hear for the time to come?

18505.text: /Who gave Jacob as plunder,/_and Israel to the robbers?/_Didn’t Yahweh, he against whom we have sinned?/_For they would not walk in his ways,/_and they disobeyed his law.

18506.text: /Therefore he poured the fierceness of his anger on him,/_and the strength of battle;/_and it set him on fire all around, but he didn’t know;/_and it burned him, but he didn’t take it to heart.”

18507.text: ¶But now Yahweh who created you, Jacob,/_and he who formed you, Israel says:/“Don’t be afraid, for I have redeemed you./_I have called you by your name./_You are mine.

18508.text: /When you pass through the waters, I will be with you;/_and through the rivers, they will not overflow you./When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned,/_and flame will not scorch you.

18509.text: /For I am Yahweh your God,/_the Holy One of Israel,/_your Savior./I have given Egypt as your ransom,/_Ethiopia and Seba in your place.

18510.text: /Since you have been precious and honored in my sight,/_and I have loved you;/_therefore I will give people in your place,/_and nations instead of your life.

18511.text: /Don’t be afraid; for I am with you./_I will bring your offspring from the east,/_and gather you from the west.

18512.text: /I will tell the north, ‘Give them up!’/_and tell the south, ‘Don’t hold them back!/_Bring my sons from far,/_and my daughters from the ends of the earth—

18513.text: /everyone who is called by my name,/_and whom I have created for my glory,/_whom I have formed,/_yes, whom I have made.’”

18514.text: ¶Bring out the blind people who have eyes,/_and the deaf who have ears.

18515.text: /Let all the nations be gathered together,/_and let the peoples be assembled./Who among them can declare this,/_and show us former things?/Let them bring their witnesses, that they may be justified;/_or let them hear, and say, “That is true.”

18516.text: ¶“You are my witnesses,” says Yahweh,/_“With my servant whom I have chosen;/_that you may know and believe me,/_and understand that I am he./Before me there was no God formed,/_neither will there be after me.

18517.text: /I myself am Yahweh;/_and besides me there is no savior.

18518.text: /I have declared, I have saved, and I have shown;/_and there was no strange god among you./Therefore you are my witnesses”,/_says Yahweh, “and I am God.

18519.text: /Yes, since the day was I am he;/_and there is no one who can deliver out of my hand./_I will work, and who can hinder it?”

18520.text: ¶Yahweh, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel says: “For your sake, I have sent to Babylon, and I will bring all of them down as fugitives, even the Chaldeans, in the ships of their rejoicing.

18521.text: I am Yahweh, your Holy One, the Creator of Israel, your King.”

18522.text: ¶Yahweh, who makes a way in the sea,¶▼and a path in the mighty waters says:

18523.text: /who brings out the chariot and horse,/_the army and the mighty man/_(they lie down together, they shall not rise;/_they are extinct, they are quenched like a wick):

18524.text: /“Don’t remember the former things,/_and don’t consider the things of old.

18525.text: /Behold, I will do a new thing./_It springs out now./_Don’t you know it?/I will even make a way in the wilderness,/_and rivers in the desert.

18526.text: /The animals of the field shall honor me,/_the jackals and the ostriches;/because I give water in the wilderness and rivers in the desert,/_to give drink to my people, my chosen,

18527.text: /_the people which I formed for myself,/_that they might declare my praise.

18528.text: /Yet you have not called on me, Jacob;/_but you have been weary of me, Israel.

18529.text: /You have not brought me of your sheep for burnt offerings;/_neither have you honored me with your sacrifices./I have not burdened you with offerings,/_nor wearied you with frankincense.

18530.text: /You have bought me no sweet cane with money,/_nor have you filled me with the fat of your sacrifices;/but you have burdened me with your sins./_You have wearied me with your iniquities.

18531.text: /I, even I, am he who blots out your transgressions for my own sake;/_and I will not remember your sins.

18532.text: /Put me in remembrance./_Let us plead together./Declare your case,/_that you may be justified.

18533.text: /Your first father sinned,/_and your teachers have transgressed against me.

18534.text: /Therefore I will profane the princes of the sanctuary;/_and I will make Jacob a curse,/_and Israel an insult.”

18535.text: ¶Yet listen now, Jacob my servant,/_and Israel, whom I have chosen.

18536.text: /This is what Yahweh who made you,/_and formed you from the womb,/_who will help you says:/“Don’t be afraid, Jacob my servant;/_and you, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.

18537.text: /For I will pour water on him who is thirsty,/_and streams on the dry ground./I will pour my Spirit on your descendants,/_and my blessing on your offspring:

18538.text: /and they will spring up among the grass,/_as willows by the watercourses.

18539.text: /One will say, ‘I am Yahweh’s;’/_and another will be called by the name of Jacob;/_and another will write with his hand ‘to Yahweh,’/_and honor the name of Israel.”

18540.text: ¶This is what Yahweh, the King of Israel,/_and his Redeemer, Yahweh of Armies, says:/“I am the first, and I am the last;/_and besides me there is no God.

18541.text: /Who is like me?/_Who will call,/_and will declare it,/_and set it in order for me,/_since I established the ancient people?/Let them declare the things that are coming,/_and that will happen.

18542.text: /Don’t fear,/_neither be afraid./Haven’t I declared it to you long ago,/_and shown it?/You are my witnesses./_Is there a God besides me?/Indeed, there is not./_I don’t know any other Rock.”

18543.text: ¶Everyone who makes an engraved image is vain./_The things that they delight in will not profit./_Their own witnesses don’t see, nor know, that they may be disappointed.

18544.text: /Who has fashioned a god,/_or molds an image that is profitable for nothing?

18545.text: /Behold, all his fellows will be disappointed;/_and the workmen are mere men./Let them all be gathered together./_Let them stand up./_They will fear./_They will be put to shame together.

18546.text: /The blacksmith takes an ax,/_works in the coals,/_fashions it with hammers,/_and works it with his strong arm./He is hungry,/_and his strength fails;/he drinks no water,/_and is faint.

18547.text: /The carpenter stretches out a line./_He marks it out with a pencil./_He shapes it with planes./_He marks it out with compasses,/_and shapes it like the figure of a man,/_with the beauty of a man,/_to reside in a house.

18548.text: /He cuts down cedars for himself,/_and takes the cypress and the oak,/_and strengthens for himself one among the trees of the forest./He plants a cypress tree,/_and the rain nourishes it.

18549.text: /Then it will be for a man to burn;/_and he takes some of it, and warms himself./_Yes, he burns it, and bakes bread./Yes, he makes a god, and worships it;/_he makes it an engraved image, and falls down to it.

18550.text: /He burns part of it in the fire./_With part of it, he eats meat./_He roasts a roast, and is satisfied./Yes, he warms himself,/_and says, “Aha! I am warm. I have seen the fire.”

18551.text: /The rest of it he makes into a god,/_even his engraved image./He bows down to it and worships,/_and prays to it, and says, “Deliver me; for you are my god!”

18552.text: /They don’t know, neither do they consider:/_for he has shut their eyes, that they can’t see;/_and their hearts, that they can’t understand.

18553.text: /No one thinks,/_neither is there knowledge nor understanding to say,/_“I have burned part of it in the fire./_Yes, I have also baked bread on its coals./_I have roasted meat and eaten it./_Shall I make the rest of it into an abomination?/_Shall I bow down to a tree trunk?”

18554.text: /He feeds on ashes./_A deceived heart has turned him aside;/_and he can’t deliver his soul,/_nor say, “Isn’t there a lie in my right hand?”

18555.text: /Remember these things, Jacob and Israel;/_for you are my servant./_I have formed you./_You are my servant./_Israel, you will not be forgotten by me.

18556.text: /I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, your transgressions,/_and, as a cloud, your sins./_Return to me, for I have redeemed you.

18557.text: ¶Sing, you heavens, for Yahweh has done it!/_Shout, you lower parts of the earth!/_Break out into singing, you mountains, O forest, all of your trees,/_for Yahweh has redeemed Jacob,/_and will glorify himself in Israel.

18558.text: /Yahweh, your Redeemer,/_and he who formed you from the womb says:/“I am Yahweh, who makes all things;/_who alone stretches out the heavens;/_who spreads out the earth by myself;

18559.text: /who frustrates the signs of the liars,/_and makes diviners mad;/who turns wise men backward,/_and makes their knowledge foolish;

18560.text: /who confirms the word of his servant,/_and performs the counsel of his messengers;/who says of Jerusalem, ‘She will be inhabited;’/_and of the cities of Judah, ‘They will be built,’/_and ‘I will raise up its waste places;’

18561.text: /who says to the deep, ‘Be dry,’/_and ‘I will dry up your rivers;’

18562.text: /Who says of Cyrus, ‘He is my shepherd, and shall perform all my pleasure,’/_even saying of Jerusalem, ‘She will be built;’/_and of the temple, ‘Your foundation will be laid.’”

18563.text: ¶Yahweh says to his anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have held, to subdue nations before him, and strip kings of their armor; to open the doors before him, and the gates shall not be shut:

18564.text: ¶“I will go before you,/_and make the rough places smooth./I will break the doors of brass in pieces,/_and cut apart the bars of iron.

18565.text: /I will give you the treasures of darkness,/_and hidden riches of secret places,/that you may know that it is I, Yahweh, who call you by your name,/_even the God of Israel.

18566.text: /For Jacob my servant’s sake,/_and Israel my chosen,/I have called you by your name./_I have given you a title,/_though you have not known me.

18567.text: /I am Yahweh, and there is no one else./_Besides me, there is no God./I will strengthen you,/_though you have not known me;

18568.text: /that they may know from the rising of the sun,/_and from the west,/that there is no one besides me./_I am Yahweh, and there is no one else.

18569.text: /I form the light,/_and create darkness./I make peace,/_and create calamity./I am Yahweh,/_who does all these things.

18570.text: /Rain, you heavens, from above,/_and let the skies pour down righteousness./Let the earth open, that it may produce salvation,/_and let it cause righteousness to spring up with it./I, Yahweh, have created it.

18571.text: /Woe to him who strives with his Maker—/_a clay pot among the clay pots of the earth!/Shall the clay ask him who fashions it, ‘What are you making?’/_or your work, ‘He has no hands?’

18572.text: /Woe to him who says to a father, ‘What have you become the father of?’/_or to a mother, ‘To what have you given birth?’”

18573.text: /Yahweh, the Holy One of Israel,/_and his Maker says:/“You ask me about the things that are to come, concerning my sons,/_and you command me concerning the work of my hands!

18574.text: /I have made the earth, and created man on it./_I, even my hands, have stretched out the heavens;/_and I have commanded all their army.

18575.text: /I have raised him up in righteousness,/_and I will make straight all his ways./He shall build my city,/_and he shall let my exiles go free,/_not for price nor reward,” says Yahweh of Armies.

18576.text: /Yahweh says: “The labor of Egypt,/_and the merchandise of Ethiopia,/_and the Sabeans, men of stature, shall come over to you,/_and they shall be yours./They will go after you./_They shall come over in chains;/_and they will bow down to you./They will make supplication to you:/_‘Surely God is in you; and there is no one else./_There is no other god.

18577.text: /Most certainly you are a God who hidden yourself,/_God of Israel, the Savior.’”

18578.text: /They will be disappointed,/_yes, confounded, all of them./_Those who are makers of idols will go into confusion together.

18579.text: /Israel will be saved by Yahweh with an everlasting salvation./_You will not be disappointed nor confounded to ages everlasting.

18580.text: /For Yahweh who created the heavens,/_the God who formed the earth and made it,/_who established it and didn’t create it a waste,/_who formed it to be inhabited says:/“I am Yahweh;/_and there is no other.

18581.text: /I have not spoken in secret,/_in a place of the land of darkness./I didn’t say to the offspring of Jacob, ‘Seek me in vain.’/_I, Yahweh, speak righteousness./_I declare things that are right.

18582.text: ¶“Assemble yourselves and come./_Draw near together, you who have escaped from the nations./Those have no knowledge who carry the wood of their engraved image,/_and pray to a god that can’t save.

18583.text: /Declare and present it./_Yes, let them take counsel together./Who has shown this from ancient time?/_Who has declared it of old?/_Haven’t I, Yahweh?/There is no other God besides me, a just God and a Savior;/_There is no one besides me.

18584.text: ¶“Look to me, and be saved, all the ends of the earth;/_for I am God, and there is no other.

18585.text: /I have sworn by myself./_The word has gone out of my mouth in righteousness, and will not be revoked,/that to me every knee shall bow,/_every tongue shall take an oath.

18586.text: /They will say of me,/_‘There is righteousness and strength only in Yahweh.’”/Even to him shall men come;/_and all those who raged against him shall be disappointed.

18587.text: /All the offspring of Israel will be justified in Yahweh,/_and will rejoice!

18588.text: ¶Bel bows down./_Nebo stoops./Their idols are carried by animals,/_and on the livestock./The things that you carried around are heavy loads,/_a burden for the weary.

18589.text: /They stoop and they bow down together./_They could not deliver the burden,/_but they have gone into captivity.

18590.text: ¶“Listen to me, house of Jacob,/_and all the remnant of the house of Israel,/that have been carried from their birth,/_that have been carried from the womb.

18591.text: /Even to old age I am he,/_and even to gray hairs I will carry you./I have made, and I will bear./_Yes, I will carry, and will deliver.

18592.text: ¶“To whom will you liken me, and consider my equal,/_and compare me, that we may be equal?

18593.text: /Some pour out gold from the bag,/_and weigh silver in the balance./They hire a goldsmith,/_and he makes it a god./They fall down—/_yes, they worship.

18594.text: /They bear it on their shoulder./_They carry it, and set it in its place, and it stands there./_It cannot move from its place./Yes, one may cry to it, yet it can not answer./_It cannot save him out of his trouble.

18595.text: ¶“Remember this, and show yourselves men./_Bring it to mind again, you transgressors.

18596.text: /Remember the former things of old:/_for I am God, and there is no other./_I am God, and there is none like me.

18597.text: /I declare the end from the beginning,/_and from ancient times things that are not yet done./I say: My counsel will stand,/_and I will do all that I please.

18598.text: /I call a ravenous bird from the east,/_the man of my counsel from a far country./Yes, I have spoken./_I will also bring it to pass./I have planned./_I will also do it.

18599.text: /Listen to me, you stubborn‑hearted,/_who are far from righteousness!

18600.text: /I bring my righteousness near./_It is not far off,/_and my salvation will not wait./I will grant salvation to Zion,/_my glory to Israel.

18601.text: ¶“Come down, and sit in the dust, virgin daughter of Babylon.¶▼Sit on the ground without a throne, daughter of the Chaldeans./_For you will no longer be called tender and delicate.

18602.text: /Take the millstones, and grind flour./_Remove your veil, lift up your skirt, uncover your legs,/_and wade through the rivers.

18603.text: /Your nakedness will be uncovered./_Yes, your shame will be seen./I will take vengeance,/_and will spare no one.”

18604.text: ¶Our Redeemer, Yahweh of Armies is his name,/_is the Holy One of Israel.

18605.text: ¶“Sit in silence, and go into darkness,/_daughter of the Chaldeans./For you shall no longer be called/_the mistress of kingdoms.

18606.text: /I was angry with my people./_I profaned my inheritance,/_and gave them into your hand./You showed them no mercy./_You laid a very heavy yoke on the aged.

18607.text: /You said, ‘I will be a princess forever;’/_so that you did not lay these things to your heart,/_nor did you remember the results.

18608.text: ¶“Now therefore hear this, you who are given to pleasures,/_who sit securely,/who say in your heart,/_‘I am, and there is no one else besides me./I shall not sit as a widow,/_neither shall I know the loss of children.’

18609.text: /But these two things shall come to you in a moment in one day,/_the loss of children and widowhood./They will come on you in their full measure,/_in the multitude of your sorceries,/_and the great abundance of your enchantments.

18610.text: /For you have trusted in your wickedness./_You have said, ‘No one sees me.’/Your wisdom and your knowledge has perverted you./_You have said in your heart, ‘I am, and there is no one else besides me.’

18611.text: /Therefore disaster will come on you./_You won’t know when it dawns./Mischief will fall on you./_You won’t be able to put it away./Desolation will come on you suddenly,/_which you don’t understand.

18612.text: ¶“Stand now with your enchantments,/_and with the multitude of your sorceries,/_in which you have labored from your youth;/as if you might profit;/_as if you might prevail.

18613.text: /You are wearied in the multitude of your counsels./_Now let the astrologers, the stargazers, and the monthly prognosticators, stand up and save you from the things that will come on you.

18614.text: /Behold, they shall are like stubble./_The fire will burn them./_They won’t deliver themselves from the power of the flame./It won’t be a coal to warm at/_or a fire to sit by.

18615.text: /The things that you labored in will be like this:/_those who have trafficked with you from your youth will each wander in his own way./_There will be no one to save you.

18616.text: ¶“Hear this, house of Jacob,/_you who are called by the name of Israel,/_and have come out of the waters of Judah./You swear by Yahweh’s name,/_and make mention of the God of Israel,/_but not in truth, nor in righteousness

18617.text: /(for they call themselves citizens of the holy city,/_and rely on the God of Israel;/_Yahweh of Armies is his name):

18618.text: /I have declared the former things from of old;/_yes, they went out of my mouth, and I revealed them./_I did them suddenly, and they happened.

18619.text: /Because I knew that you are obstinate,/_and your neck is an iron sinew,/_and your brow brass;

18620.text: /therefore I have declared it to you from of old;/_before it came to pass I showed it to you;/_lest you should say, ‘My idol has done them, and my engraved image, and my molten image, has commanded them.’

18621.text: /You have heard it;/_see all this./_And you, won’t you declare it?¶“I have shown you new things from this time,/_even hidden things, which you have not known.

18622.text: /They are created now, and not from of old;/_and before today you didn’t hear them;/_lest you should say, ‘Behold, I knew them.’

18623.text: /Yes, you didn’t hear;/_yes, you didn’t know;/_yes, from of old your ear was not opened:/for I knew that you dealt very treacherously,/_and were called a transgressor from the womb.

18624.text: /For my name’s sake, I will defer my anger,/_and for my praise I hold it back for you,/_so that I don’t cut you off.

18625.text: /Behold, I have refined you,/_but not as silver./_I have chosen you in the furnace of affliction.

18626.text: /For my own sake,/_for my own sake, I will do it;/for how would my name be profaned?/_I will not give my glory to another.

18627.text: ¶“Listen to me, O Jacob,/_and Israel my called:/I am he;/_I am the first,/_I am also the last.

18628.text: /Yes, my hand has laid the foundation of the earth,/_and my right hand has spread out the heavens./_when I call to them, they stand up together.

18629.text: ¶“Assemble yourselves, all of you, and hear;/_who among them has declared these things?/He whom Yahweh loves will do what he likes to Babylon,/_and his arm will be against the Chaldeans.

18630.text: /I, even I, have spoken;/_yes, I have called him./I have brought him,/_and he shall make his way prosperous.

18631.text: ¶“Come near to me and hear this:¶▼“From the beginning I have not spoken in secret;/_from the time that it happened, I was there.”¶Now the Lord Yahweh has sent me,/_with his Spirit.

18632.text: ¶Yahweh,/_your Redeemer,/_the Holy One of Israel says:/“I am Yahweh your God,/_who teaches you to profit,/_who leads you by the way that you should go.

18633.text: /Oh that you had listened to my commandments!/_Then your peace would have been like a river,/_and your righteousness like the waves of the sea.

18634.text: /Your offspring also would have been as the sand,/_and the descendants of your body like its grains./_His name would not be cut off nor destroyed from before me.”

18635.text: /Leave Babylon!/_Flee from the Chaldeans!/With a voice of singing announce this,/_tell it even to the end of the earth:/_say, “Yahweh has redeemed his servant Jacob!”

18636.text: /They didn’t thirst when he led them through the deserts./_He caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them./_He split the rock also, and the waters gushed out.

18637.text: ¶“There is no peace”, says Yahweh, “for the wicked.”

18638.text: ¶Listen, islands, to me./_Listen, you peoples, from afar:/Yahweh has called me from the womb;/_from the inside of my mother he has mentioned my name.

18639.text: /He has made my mouth like a sharp sword./_He has hidden me in the shadow of his hand./He has made me a polished shaft./_He has kept me close in his quiver.

18640.text: /He said to me, “You are my servant;/_Israel, in whom I will be glorified.”

18641.text: /But I said, “I have labored in vain./_I have spent my strength in vain for nothing;/yet surely the justice due to me is with Yahweh,/_and my reward with my God.”

18642.text: /Now Yahweh says, he who formed me from the womb to be his servant,/_to bring Jacob again to him,/_and to gather Israel to him,/_for I am honorable in Yahweh’s eyes,/_and my God has become my strength.

18643.text: /Indeed, he says, “It is too light a thing that you should be my servant to raise up the tribes of Jacob,/_and to restore the preserved of Israel?/I will also give you as a light to the nations,/_that you may be my salvation to the end of the earth.”

18644.text: /Yahweh, the Redeemer of Israel, and his Holy One,/_says to him whom man despises, to him whom the nation abhors, to a servant of rulers:/“Kings shall see and rise up;/_princes, and they shall worship;/_because of Yahweh who is faithful, even the Holy One of Israel, who has chosen you.”

18645.text: /Yahweh says, “In an acceptable time I have answered you,/_and in a day of salvation I have helped you./I will preserve you, and give you for a covenant of the people,/_to raise up the land, to make them inherit the desolate heritage:

18646.text: /saying to those who are bound, ‘Come out!’;/_to those who are in darkness, ‘Show yourselves!’/“They shall feed along the paths,/_and their pasture shall be on all treeless heights.

18647.text: /They shall not hunger nor thirst;/_neither shall the heat nor sun strike them:/_for he who has mercy on them will lead them./_He will guide them by springs of water.

18648.text: /I will make all my mountains a road,/_and my highways shall be exalted.

18649.text: /Behold, these shall come from afar;/_and behold, these from the north and from the west;/_and these from the land of Sinim.”

18650.text: /Sing, heavens; and be joyful, earth;/_and break out into singing, mountains:/for Yahweh has comforted his people,/_and will have compassion on his afflicted.

18651.text: /But Zion said, “Yahweh has forsaken me,/_and the Lord has forgotten me.”

18652.text: /“Can a woman forget her nursing child,/_that she should not have compassion on the son of her womb?/Yes, these may forget,/_yet I will not forget you!

18653.text: /Behold, I have engraved you on the palms of my hands./_your walls are continually before me.

18654.text: /Your children hurry./_Your destroyers and those who devastated you will leave you.

18655.text: /Lift up your eyes all around, and see:/_all these gather themselves together, and come to you./As I live,” says Yahweh, “you shall surely clothe yourself with them all as with an ornament,/_and dress yourself with them, like a bride.

18656.text: /“For, as for your waste and your desolate places,/_and your land that has been destroyed,/surely now that land will be too small for the inhabitants,/_and those who swallowed you up will be far away.

18657.text: /The children of your bereavement will say in your ears,/_‘This place is too small for me./_Give me a place to live in.’

18658.text: /Then you will say in your heart, ‘Who has conceived these for me, since I have been bereaved of my children,/_and am solitary, an exile, and wandering back and forth?/Who has brought these up?/_Behold, I was left alone. Where were these?’”

18659.text: /Thus says the Lord Yahweh, “Behold, I will lift up my hand to the nations,/_and lift up my banner to the peoples;/and they shall bring your sons in their bosom,/_and your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders.

18660.text: /Kings shall be your foster fathers,/_and their queens your nursing mothers./They will bow down to you with their faces to the earth,/_and lick the dust of your feet;/Then you will know that I am Yahweh;/_and those who wait for me shall not be disappointed.”

18661.text: /Shall the plunder be taken from the mighty,/_or the lawful captives be delivered?

18662.text: /But Yahweh says, “Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away,/_and the plunder retrieved from the fierce;/for I will contend with him who contends with you,/_and I will save your children.

18663.text: /I will feed those who oppress you with their own flesh;/_and they will be drunk on their own blood, as with sweet wine./Then all flesh shall know that I, Yahweh, am your Savior,/_and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.”

18664.text: ¶Yahweh says, “Where is the bill of your mother’s divorce, with which I have put her away?/_or to which of my creditors have I sold you?/Behold, you were sold for your iniquities,/_and your mother was put away for your transgressions.

18665.text: /Why, when I came, was there no one?/_when I called, why was there no one to answer?/Is my hand shortened at all, that it can’t redeem?/_or have I no power to deliver?/Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea./_I make the rivers a wilderness:/_their fish stink, because there is no water, and die for thirst.

18666.text: /I clothe the heavens with blackness,/_and I make sackcloth their covering.”

18667.text: ¶The Lord Yahweh has given me the tongue of those who are taught,/_that I may know how to sustain with words him who is weary./He wakens morning by morning,/_he wakens my ear to hear as those who are taught.

18668.text: /The Lord Yahweh has opened my ear,/_and I was not rebellious./_I have not turned back.

18669.text: /I gave my back to those who beat me,/_and my cheeks to those who plucked off the hair./_I didn’t hide my face from shame and spitting.

18670.text: /For the Lord Yahweh will help me./_Therefore I have not been confounded./Therefore I have set my face like a flint,/_and I know that I shall not be disappointed.

18671.text: /He who justifies me is near./_Who will bring charges against me?/Let us stand up together./_Who is my adversary?/_Let him come near to me.

18672.text: /Behold, the Lord Yahweh will help me!/_Who is he who will condemn me?/Behold, they will all grow old like a garment./_The moths will eat them up.

18673.text: /Who among you fears Yahweh,/_and obeys the voice of his servant?/He who walks in darkness,/_and has no light,/let him trust in Yahweh’s name,/_and rely on his God.

18674.text: /Behold, all you who kindle a fire,/_who adorn yourselves with torches around yourselves;/walk in the flame of your fire,/_and among the torches that you have kindled./You will have this from my hand:/You will lie down in sorrow.

18675.text: ¶“Listen to me, you who follow after righteousness,/_you who seek Yahweh:/look to the rock you were cut from,/_and to the quarry you were dug from.

18676.text: /Look to Abraham your father,/_and to Sarah who bore you;/for when he was but one I called him,/_and I blessed him,/_and made him many.

18677.text: /For Yahweh has comforted Zion./_He has comforted all her waste places,/_and has made her wilderness like Eden,/_and her desert like the garden of Yahweh./Joy and gladness will be found therein,/_thanksgiving, and the voice of melody.

18678.text: ¶“Listen to me, my people;/_and hear me, my nation:/for a law will go out from me,/_and I will establish my justice for a light to the peoples.

18679.text: /My righteousness is near./_My salvation has gone out,/_and my arms will judge the peoples./The islands will wait for me,/_and they will trust my arm.
